Hey BMES!

As we gear up for the 2024-2025 academic year, we are excited to announce *five
impactful opportunities to join our Executive Board*: Chief of Finance,
Chief of Operations, Chief of Marketing, Chief of Partnerships, and Chief
Event Coordinator.*

Each of these roles will have distinct responsibilities, but everyone on
the board will participate in the following:

   - Speaker Outreach: Engage with potential speakers for events,
   coordinate their participation, and ensure a diverse range of speakers.
   - Brand Promotion: Act as ambassadors for the BMES brand, both on campus
   and beyond, to increase visibility and engagement.
   - Event Ideation: Collaborate in brainstorming and planning various
   events to cater to the interests and needs of the club members.
   - Event Attendance: Demonstrate commitment by attending all club events
   and encouraging others to do the same.

üéØ *APPLY HERE*
> <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSezQyqjkLtif3HXKuuPaW5iJV-lhCme22dFGgtZ99PgYbPp7w/viewform?usp=sf_link>
>  üéØ

To ensure a seamless transition and empower our future leaders, *shadowing
and training sessions will commence in February of the Spring
semester,* equipping
you with the essential resources, tools, and connections.* By Fall 2024, *each
role will operate autonomously, offering a platform for you to make a
significant impact.

Join us in shaping the future of medical entrepreneurship at Brown
University and beyond. Your journey towards leadership and innovation
starts here.

**Except for the Chief of Operations position, which gives preference to
first-year applicants during our selection process, we welcome individuals
from all class years to apply for any of the available roles.*

*üö®Application Deadline: Friday, January 26th *

*üóìÔ∏è Interviews will take place the week of January 28th *

--

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: BPEC <bpec@brown.edu>
Date: Wed, Jan 24, 2024 at 2:14‚ÄØPM
Subject: Welcome Back BPEC!
To: <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


Welcome back from the Brown Private Equity Club! We have an exciting
semester ahead and look forward to having you join us. Continue reading
below to find internship opportunities, industry headlines, and more!

------------------------------
*DUE TONIGHT: Riverspan Partners Summer Analyst Application*
*Riverspan Partners is a Chicago-based private equity group that helps
businesses successfully transition through growth inflection points by
offering guidance, operational expertise, and capital. They partner with
middle-market industrial companies to make control-oriented investments. By
working closely with founders and leadership teams to understand their
goals and market opportunities, they help businesses reach a higher level
of performance and build durable, long-term success. *
Click Here to Apply!
<https://brownpeclub.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=b60d537c4274807046034e7a2&id=819b15da63&e=d95fd0436e>

*BlackRock to Acquire Global Infrastructure Partners for $12.5 billion*

*The world‚Äôs largest asset manager, BlackRock, with over $10 trillion in
total assets as of the end of Q4, agreed to acquire Global Infrastructure
Partners. The New York-based private equity firm has about $100 billion AUM
and owns stakes in energy, transportation, and water and waste companies.
This includes Gatwick Airport, Venice Airport, and Melbourne Port.
BlackRock, mainly known for its core business in low-fee passive investment
products, is pushing into the more lucrative private markets. Combining GIP
with its in-house infrastructure will make BlackRock the second-largest
private infrastructure manager and double its overall private-market base
fees. BlackRock CEO Larry Fink views infrastructure as a long-term
investment opportunity. Policy-makers are about to implement generational
financial incentives for infrastructure projects due to growing government
deficits, increasing the need for private financing. BlackRock favored this
opportunity over more traditional buyout firms, whose best returns, they
believe, came in the near-zero interest era. *
*PE Fundraising Bounceback Unlikely in 2024*

*High interest rates and tight M&A and IPO markets have made it difficult
for private equity firms to generate returns since 2022. The industry‚Äôs net
internal rate of return was -4.5% between March 2022 and March 2023. At the
same time, more than 4,000 funds in the market aim to raise a combined $1.2
trillion. This is three times more than the number of funds in 2019. Many
institutional investors, therefore, have a plethora of options to choose
from while returns remain unattractive. According to a survey by Probitas
Partners, only 15% are committed to finding new places to put their
capital. PE firms, including Carlyle Group, have responded by laying off
staff and closing underperforming offices and business arms. They are also
refocusing their fundraising operations on sources of capital that have
remained steady, including high-net-worth individuals and Middle Eastern
sovereign wealth funds. So, while the Fed appears to be ready to cut rates
in 2024, this will only happen gradually and more towards the end of the
year, likely making 2024 another challenging year for PE firms. *
*A Hot Debt Market is Slashing Borrowing Costs for Riskier Companies*
*Companies with low credit ratings have seen some success recently in
regards to selling debt. After a broad rally in stocks and bonds which
began last year, when investors viewed the likelihood of falling inflation
alongside a stable economy, prices of leveraged loans (ex. for PE fund
buyouts) have jumped especially high. This broad rise has caused riskier
companies to have some freedom to renegotiate their debts, as increased
confidence inclined investors to prefer lowering interest rates over giving
up the loan altogether. For example, companies SeaWorld Entertainment and
Dave & Buster‚Äôs have asked investors to cut rates on $62b of sub-investment
grade loans, showing how broad changes in the debt space can affect all
sorts of companies drastically.*

*Bain Capital Closes $1 Billion Mid Market Credit Fund*

*Bain Capital, one of the world‚Äôs largest private investment firms, has
finished raising over $1 billion for their new midmarket credit fund. This
fund is meant to provide flexible, junior debt to midmarket companies:
providing financing in debt types such as unsecured loans, second-lien, and
preferred equity, and more. However, this is not the firm‚Äôs first
experience with this kind of asset - they have had three prior funds
focusing on midmarket credit, particularly on Western companies in the
$25m-75m EBITDA range. Their previous firm, Bain Capital‚Äôs 3rd in this
space, raised $975m to begin with. This change by Bain Capital to increase
in investment in private credit is in part due to the recent nature of Fed
policy, as with higher interest rates, high-yield bond prices fall and
leveraged loans dry up, leaving companies struggling to find traditional
financing. Thus, private credit investment as a whole exploded, indicating
to Bain that they should take note.*

Metabolomics in Systems Biology
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001bD3txC2lP3wVRPX8ffQp_aLTPekj8oMqavR0Q7-XKEsOIJsy6EbvezqmHmQhU6xYxcwlbm02YbzW6V9wp7gniEkMgx8-jfGJ6V8hQN6NbeaKVEO6rGQeg4-1cgH0qFSsiaWLFurwb03Jk36htOI97Trzc0eH58kcvZ_ji9AxLsKy3dbD5BolR_LH9sdv_DEGON3tAXjEtyJ2h-0gKoshj6g0cbjMGygA8hznqzEhXWvNBao-FG1dxw==&c=nC8f0lYC3ZBgJuF3Fg4orYXWjcuZ-SCbrAl7jLUEhOezF9p4c9nFmg==&ch=qW_iu1XopTVrqfPlxgoyInqxGnMU1nOb3X51XMx96_CioaJT_mJXgg==>


Karthikeyani Chellappa, Molecular Microbiology and Immunology, Brown
University


Metabolism, a fundamental biological process in all living organisms, goes
awry in most human diseases. Metabolomics analysis of small molecules are
poised to identify biomolecules and pathways relevant to complex disease
etiology in humans. The Chellappa lab
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001bD3txC2lP3wVRPX8ffQp_aLTPekj8oMqavR0Q7-XKEsOIJsy6Ebvey7eFoqpfqKdceuv91J1MS0z41uk6llnZtSpatzfO43YGnnoY8HuP2Cy84DLN9lRUM7kQoB6xmAREnyxie77RiaTVm2i0j-m6rHH1oCE6puC&c=nC8f0lYC3ZBgJuF3Fg4orYXWjcuZ-SCbrAl7jLUEhOezF9p4c9nFmg==&ch=qW_iu1XopTVrqfPlxgoyInqxGnMU1nOb3X51XMx96_CioaJT_mJXgg==>
focuses
on using stable-isotope tracing and metabolomics analysis to understand the
dynamic role of metabolism in mammalian metaorganism (host + microbiome).
Dr. Chellappa will present two stories highlighting the use of
stable-isotope tracing to address long-standing questions on a century-old
molecule relevant to aging biology and gut microbiome.
Wednesday, January 31, 4:00 pm 164 Angell Street, Room 302 and on Zoom
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001bD3txC2lP3wVRPX8ffQp_aLTPekj8oMqavR0Q7-XKEsOIJsy6Ebvey7eFoqpfqKdR1jWo80esSMTk_3qErDNjfli7MqdZHCcCvc6ZuK50orRI69owhb6I-GGG-k2jmKyFBqnYCU7oADcYMku9W4EMWzYNw9wD1P8&c=nC8f0lYC3ZBgJuF3Fg4orYXWjcuZ-SCbrAl7jLUEhOezF9p4c9nFmg==&ch=qW_iu1XopTVrqfPlxgoyInqxGnMU1nOb3X51XMx96_CioaJT_mJXgg==>

Subject: Fwd: New year, new you, new ventures to build and develop!
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship <entrepreneurship@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Jan 30, 2024 at 10:14‚ÄØPM
Subject: New year, new you, new ventures to build and develop!
To: <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


The Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship at Brown University
View this email in your browser
<https://mailchi.mp/brown/nce_newsletter_01_30_2024_student-487578?e=bfa110a20d>

Greetings,

Welcome back to school! The Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship hopes you
had a restful winter break and are back to tackle the semester with renewed
fervor! We have been hard at work lining up events, talks, and curricula to
support our budding entrepreneurship community! Read on to see what is
happening at the Nelson Center and beyond:

   -

   *Brown EP Info Session* | January 30 @ 7:00 pm
   -

   *Regent Craft at Brown University* | February 2 @ 12:00 pm
   -

   *B-Lab/BVP Application Deadline* | February 2 @ 1:00 pm
   -

   *Book Talk with Claire Hughes Johnson ‚Äò94* | February 6 @ 12:00 pm
   -

   *Office Hours with immigration attorney Jeff Goldman ‚Äò83* | February 15
   @ 12:00 pm

and more‚Ä¶

Keep scrolling to register for upcoming events and explore opportunities.

Ever True,
The Nelson Center Team

*B-Lab and Brown Venture Prize (BVP) Application Deadline!*
Friday, February 2 | 1:00 PM

Are you a current Brown or RISD student with a venture you want to take to
the next level? Apply to join the 2024 B-Lab
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=944011b891&e=bfa110a20d>cohort
or 2024 Brown Venture Prize
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=d9c0a9df13&e=bfa110a20d>
(BVP) competition and receive the support to grow your venture. The
application deadline is Friday, February 2 @ 1:00 pm!

B-Lab Application Link: https://forms.gle/p7fRBPh3YVZFZH1P8
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=8b36f3ed1d&e=bfa110a20d>
BVP Application Link: https://forms.gle/zVoftPLthwgMkh2Z7
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=70753ea41b&e=bfa110a20d>

*Book Talk | Scaling People: Tactics for Management and Company Building
with  Claire Hughes Johnson ‚Äò94*
Tuesday, February 6 | Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship | 12:00 pm - 1:00
pm

We are thrilled to welcome Claire Hughes Johnson ‚Äô94, to the Nelson Center
for Entrepreneurship to speak about her new book! Learn how Claire helped
grow Stripe Financial Services from a company of 300 people to a global
organization with 8,000 employees. She shares her best practices in her
recent book, Scaling People: Tactics for Management and Company Building.

You can obtain a free copy of Scaling People by being one of the first 40
people to arrive, or you can purchase it here
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=819aeeb1e5&e=bfa110a20d>
.
RSVP Here
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=e31867f994&e=bfa110a20d>

*REGENT Craft at Brown University | Connecting Talent with Opportunities in
Blue Tech*
Friday, February 2 | Liz Lange Lecture Hall | 12:00 pm - 1:00 pm

Join us for an exclusive event hosted by REGENT Craft to learn about their
founding, evolving technology, progress, and goals. Don‚Äôt miss the chance
to explore full-time and internship opportunities in business and technical
roles at this exciting Rhode Island company! Check out the event schedule
below to make the most of your time:

*Event Schedule:*
12:00 - 1:00 PM: Overview of Regent Craft (Lunch will be provided)
1:00 - 2:00 PM: Breakout Sessions
2:00 - 2:30 PM: Group Q&A

*Feel free to join us for the hour overview or stay for the overview and
breakout sessions.*

*Office Hours with Jeff Goldman ‚Äò83*
Thursday, February 15 | Online Session | 12:00 pm - 3:00 pm

Jeff Goldman ‚Äô83 is an immigration lawyer with over 30 years of experience
advising immigrant entrepreneurs, founders, and individuals about their
strategic immigration options. Jeff has successfully filed thousands of
H-1B and L-1 petitions, and more than 1400 PERM Labor Certification
applications.

A significant part of Jeff‚Äôs practice is working with scientists and
entrepreneurs seeking Extraordinary Ability, National Interest Waiver, and
Outstanding Researcher permanent residence classifications. As a mentor to
MIT, Harvard, Stanford, and Brown students, as well as Y Combinator,
TechStars, and Mass Challenge founders, Jeff has helped entrepreneurial
founders and investors understand and implement effective immigration
strategies.
Sign Up Here
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=e90ed052b2&e=bfa110a20d>

*Brown EP: New Co-Presidents and Info Session!*
The Nelson Center‚Äôs student-led Brown Entrepreneurship Program (BrownEP) is
excited to announce two new co-presidents, Sohum Sanu ‚Äò25 and Julia
Stepanenko ‚Äò26. Founded in 1998, Brown EP has facilitated a wide array of
activities on campus for more than two decades to develop the
entrepreneurship environment at Brown.

Interested in joining EP and being a part of the entrepreneurial community
here at Brown? Attend the info session on January 30, 7pm!

Application Link
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=6330e7de1b&e=bfa110a20d>



*[image: :mag_right:] Looking for entrepreneurship courses this semester?
 [image: :books:] Consider these:*

   - *ENGN 0900, Managerial Decision Making* | TTH 1:00-2:20 PM |
   Chaltas/Hazeltine

   - *ENGN 0020, Transforming Society-Technology and Choices for the Future*
   | MWF 11:00-11:50, T 10:30-11:50, TH 10:30-11:50, T 2:30-3:50 ,TH 2:30-3:50
   | Jason Harry

   - *ENGN 1010, The Entrepreneurial Process* | MW 10:30-11:50 | Hamzah
   Ansari

   - *ENGN1931T, Entrepreneurship Practicum* | MW 8:00-9:20 PM | Jessica Kim

   - *ENGN 1931T, Entrepreneurship Practicum* | MW 3:00-4:20 PM | Abigail
   Kohler

   - *ENGN 1931T, Entrepreneurship Practicum* | TTH 1:00-2:20 PM | Jonas
   Clark

   - *ENGN 1820, Future of Work* | T 4:00-6:30 PM | Banu Ozkazanc-Pan

   - *ENGN 1932R, Leadership in Organizations* | F 4:00-6:30 PM | Banu
   Ozkazanc-Pan

   - *ENVS 1207, Eco Entrepreneurship* | T 4:00-6:30 PM | Alice Nichols

   - *GNSS1101, A Gender Perspective on Women in Enterprise* | T 4:00-6:30
   PM | Linda Scott

   - *ENGN 1932D, Qualitative Market Research for Entrepreneurs & Business
   Innovators* | W 3:00-5:30 | Angus Kingon

   - *URBN1943, The Real Estate Development Process: An Entrepreneurial
   Lens *|T 4:00-6:30 PM | Jon Cohen

*New England Medical Innovation Center (NEMIC) Financial Planning for All:
Strategies for Effective Money Management*
February 21 | 150 Chestnut Street | 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm

In this engaging session on financial planning, Elizabeth Desautel, CFP¬ÆÔ∏è
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=0d4f6319ed&e=bfa110a20d>
will share her expertise in navigating the complexities of financial
planning to ensure a secure and prosperous future for all attendees.

Registration Link:
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=eba12ed54d&e=bfa110a20d>
https://nemic.org/empower-series/financial-planning
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=cc2a366ab8&e=bfa110a20d>

*Venture Cafe: Cleantech Open North East Kickoff*
February 22 | 225 Dyer St | 5:45 pm - 6:45 pm

Come join Cleantech Open Northeast for their annual kickoff at Venture Cafe
Providence! Learn how the accelerator program can help you develop your
cleantech venture and how to apply to the accelerator.

Registration Link:
https://venturecafeprovidence.org/sessions/cleantech-open-northeast-kick-off/
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=fb2c4b4875&e=bfa110a20d>

*Hult Prize Foundation*

The Hult Prize 2024 program cycle has begun and this year the $1M global
competition is UNLIMITED. The Hult Prize invites you to join the world's
premier student pitch competition and turn your startup idea into reality.
As a participant, you'll connect with a global community of like-minded
peers, receive mentorship from industry leaders, and have the opportunity
to shape the future through innovation.
Registration Link:
https://www.hultprize.org/startup-pre-registration-is-now-open/
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=eafb18063f&e=bfa110a20d>



*Our mission is to empower the Brown community to create solutions with
impact. The Nelson Center's work inspires entrepreneurship on campus
through new courses and curricular experiences, speaking events and
workshops, and venture support programs and initiatives for student
entrepreneurs. This would not be possible without the sustained commitment
of our supporters. Learn more about the Nelson Center's impact
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=4db6a4ee63&e=bfa110a20d>.*
Have an event, announcement, or opportunity you'd like to share with the
Brown Entrepreneurship community? Fill out our submission form
<https://brown.us14.list-manage.com/track/click?u=34304620f04537e98b3c03623&id=3ac1e7e42d&e=bfa110a20d>
for
approval.

Subject: Fwd: „ÄêPlease Read!„ÄëWelcome Back!; Upcoming iQuHack participants; This semester's Operation
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Quantum Computing at Brown <qc@brown.edu>
Date: Wed, Jan 31, 2024 at 9:46‚ÄØAM
Subject: „ÄêPlease Read!„ÄëWelcome Back!; Upcoming iQuHack participants; This
semester's Operation
To: <QCAB@listserv.brown.edu>


Hello QuBears!

Welcome back on campus! I hope you all had a nice and relaxing winter
break. We are so excited to see you all this semester in our events!

*[iQuHack 2024]*
As a lot of you may already, MIT is hosting their annual quantum hackathon
iQuHack this weekend. Although we are not competing as a club this year,
there will be a lot of Brown students who will participate either in-person
or remotely. If you have registered for the hackathon and are already in
the Slack, you should be in great shape! Otherwise, consider applying next
year!

We would love to know who is competing this year for future reference and
team-matching purposes. If you are comfortable with putting your name and
email address for making teams or simply networking with other quantum
enthusiasts at Brown, please fill out this google sheet
<https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1oeGPm_RxFsBEs4iUUDg6wWPb70Ga4-H41YbFXJfABzg/edit?usp=sharing>
ASAP and reach out to each other. Also, a lot of hackathon-related
communication may happen on our Slack
<https://join.slack.com/t/qcbgroup/shared_invite/zt-2bjhi6eqv-E6ej1Z7xa69J~m1kqCQWPw>,
so if you haven't already, please join and keep an eye out.

*[What this semester will look like]*
Last semester, we invited a lot of speakers from the industry who gave us
invaluable knowledge and insights. This semester, we are hoping to have a
lot more in-house speakers to highlight the quantum community at Brown. We
are planning to invite professors and maybe graduate students who might be
interested in presenting their research.

As for workshops, we are expecting to have fewer, longer workshops with
different levels of difficulty. We will announce the details at our first
General Meeting, which we are trying to plan within the next two weeks.
Please bear (pun not intended) with us while we finalize the date and
location.

Thank you all for the continued support. We cannot wait to see you!

Best,
QC@B E-Board


[image: Mailtrack]
<https://mailtrack.io?utm_source=gmail&utm_medium=signature&utm_campaign=signaturevirality11&>
Sender
notified by
Mailtrack
<https://mailtrack.io?utm_source=gmail&utm_medium=signature&utm_campaign=signaturevirality11&>
02/03/24,
09:48:54 AM

Subject: Fwd: Italia Innovation Program - Summer 2024
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------


Applications for the *2024 Italia Innovation Program*
<https://summer.italiainnovation.com/> are now open!

*1st - 19th July 2024, Italy*

Make your summer unforgettable with a *fully-immersive learning experience*:
a three-week countrywide exploration of the future of Italian economy and
society with a world-class faculty, Italian business and political leaders
and a multidisciplinary cohort of global scholars.

Participants will be challenged by Italian leading brands and institutions
to rethink their operational models and value propositions, all while
receiving the mentorship of a* unique team of experts and professors* like
John Paul Rollert (UChicago Booth), Stewart Thornhill (UMichigan Ross),
William Peduto (former Mayor of Pittsburgh), Peter Boatwright (Carnegie
Mellon University), as well as journalists like Amy Goldstein (2002
Pulitzer Award, The Washington Post) and Elizabeth Segran (Fast Company).

Company visits, industry insights, hands-on seminars, inspirational talks
foster the industry understanding and inspire the project works.* Case
studies and visits* are developed directly with leaders and owners of *leading
brands in the Made in Italy* business sectors (Fashion, Design, Food and
Wine, Arts and High-end Manufacturing). Past challengers include Zegna,
Ferragamo, Gucci, Barilla, Lavazza and illy Coffee.

Accommodation and local transportation are designed to offer a *true
Italian experience*, residing inside a 18th century Palladian Villa and
moving around the country with a comfortable double-decker premium coach.

We really believe in innovating the Italian economy and society. Do you?

*Apply now* <https://summer.italiainnovation.com/apply/> and please note
that *full and partial tuition scholarships* are available for early
applicants!

--------------------------
Carlotta Borruto | Co-Founder and Executive Director
*Italia Innovation* || italiainnovation.com

This message is being sent from Italia Innovation Srl and may contain
information which is confidential or privileged. Italia Innovation is a
trademark registered in the U.S. and other countries.

Please attend! (Ideally in person if you can!)

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: <reception@cs.brown.edu>
Date: Thu, Feb 1, 2024 at 10:14 AM
Subject: [Brown CS Talks] Talk: Eunsol Choi in Room 368 TODAY at Noon
To: <talks@lists.cs.brown.edu>


Eunsol Choi
Computer Science Department
University of Texas at Austin
Thursday, February 1, 2024 at Noon
Room 368 (CIT - 3rd floor)
Zoom: https://brown.zoom.us/j/95590372847
Add to Calendar
<http://www.google.com/calendar/event?action=TEMPLATE&text=Knowledge%20Augmentation%20for%20Language%20Models&dates=20240201T170000Z/20240201T180000Z&details=Eunsol%20Choi%0A%20%20Computer%20Science%20Department%0A%20%20University%20of%20Texas%20at%20Austin%0A%20%20Thursday%2C%20February%201%2C%202024%20at%20Noon%0A%20%20Room%20368%20(CIT%20-%203rd%20floor)%0A%0A%0A%20%20Modern%20language%20models%20(LMs)%20store%20and%20use%20immense%20amounts%20of%20knowledge%20about%20the%20real%20world.%20However%2C%20their%20knowledge%2C%20acquired%20during%20pre-training%20on%20web%20corpora%2C%20can%20be%20incorrect%2C%20misleading%20or%20outdated.%20In%20this%20talk%2C%20I%20will%20discuss%20two%20complementary%20avenues%20for%20augmenting%20knowledge%20in%20LMs.%20First%2C%20I%20will%20present%20a%20modular%2C%20retrieval-based%20approach%20which%20provides%20new%20information%20in-context%20at%20inference%20time.%20We%20improve%20in-context%20retrieval%20augmentation%20by%20learning%20a%20compressor%20which%20summarizes%20retrieved%20documents%20into%20textual%20summaries%2C%20enabling%20adaptive%20and%20efficient%20augmentation.%20In%20the%20second%20half%20of%20the%20talk%2C%20I%20will%20present%20a%20parameter%20updating%20approach%20which%20aims%20to%20enable%20models%20to%20internalize%20new%20information.%20Our%20distillation-based%20approach%20outperforms%20existing%20approaches%20in%20propagating%20injected%20knowledge%20to%20enable%20broader%20inferences.%20Together%2C%20this%20talk%20outlines%20the%20challenges%20and%20progresses%20of%20knowledge%20augmentation%20for%20LMs.%0A%20%20%0A%20%20Eunsol%20Choi%20is%20an%20assistant%20professor%20in%20the%20Computer%20Science%20department%20at%20the%20University%20of%20Texas%20at%20Austin.%20Prior%20to%20UT%2C%20she%20spent%20a%20year%20at%20Google%20AI%20as%20a%20visiting%20researcher.%20She%20received%20a%20Ph.D.%20from%20University%20of%20Washington%20and%20B.A%20from%20Cornell%20University.%20Her%20research%20area%20spans%20natural%20language%20processing%20and%20machine%20learning.%20She%20is%20particularly%20interested%20in%20interpreting%20and%20reasoning%20about%20text%20in%20a%20dynamic%20real%20world%20context.%20She%20is%20a%20recipient%20of%20a%20Facebook%20research%20fellowship%2C%20Google%20faculty%20research%20award%2C%20Sony%20faculty%20award%2C%20and%20an%20outstanding%20paper%20award%20at%20EMNLP.%0A%20%20%0A%20%20Host%3A%20Professor%20Ellie%20Pavlick&location=Watson%20Center%20for%20Information%20Technology%20(CIT)%2C%20368&trp=false&sprop=&sprop=name:>


*Knowledge Augmentation for Language Models*

Modern language models (LMs) store and use immense amounts of knowledge
about the real world. However, their knowledge, acquired during
pre-training on web corpora, can be incorrect, misleading or outdated. In
this talk, I will discuss two complementary avenues for augmenting
knowledge in LMs. First, I will present a modular, retrieval-based approach
which provides new information in-context at inference time. We improve
in-context retrieval augmentation by learning a compressor which summarizes
retrieved documents into textual summaries, enabling adaptive and efficient
augmentation. In the second half of the talk, I will present a parameter
updating approach which aims to enable models to internalize new
information. Our distillation-based approach outperforms existing
approaches in propagating injected knowledge to enable broader inferences.
Together, this talk outlines the challenges and progresses of knowledge
augmentation for LMs.

Eunsol Choi is an assistant professor in the Computer Science department at
the University of Texas at Austin. Prior to UT, she spent a year at Google
AI as a visiting researcher. She received a Ph.D. from University of
Washington and B.A from Cornell University. Her research area spans natural
language processing and machine learning. She is particularly interested in
interpreting and reasoning about text in a dynamic real world context. She
is a recipient of a Facebook research fellowship, Google faculty research
award, Sony faculty award, and an outstanding paper award at EMNLP.

Host: Professor Ellie Pavlick




_______________________________________________
The Computer Science Department is located at 115 Waterman St., Providence,
RI. Our Calendar of Events at http://www.cs.brown.edu/events lists all of
our talks.

If you would like to be removed from (or added to) our seminar mailing
list, please send email containing your request to mailto:
talks-owner@lists.cs.brown.edu.

We'd very much appreciate your forwarding these announcements to colleagues
who may also have an interest. Thanks for your cooperation.

Subject: Fwd: Upcoming Music Events
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Chen, Christopher <christopher_chen3@brown.edu>
Date: Sat, Feb 3, 2024 at 9:46‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Upcoming Music Events
To: Adam Lalani <adam_lalani@brown.edu>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Brown University Music Department <music@messages.brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Feb 2, 2024 at 3:27‚ÄØPM
Subject: Upcoming Music Events
To: christopher_chen3@brown.edu <christopher_chen3@brown.edu>


No images? Click here <https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-e-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-m/>
[image: Department of Music logo]
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-r/>



[image: a poster for the Kriolu Voices event series]
Kriolu Voices Sounding: Cabo Verdean / American Music and Politics in Rhode
Island
Tomorrow Feb 3 through Sat. Feb 17

*Kriolu Voices Sounding* is a series of four vibrant panel discussions and
participatory creative workshops. Topics include *Music as Reparations,
Cabo Verdean Kriola Feminism, Revolutionary Soundscapes*, and *Black
Atlantic Musical Resonances*. Guests include composers, vocalists from many
traditions, a DJ, hip-hop artists, scholar-practitioners, and activists.
The series was conceived as a collaboration between the Brown Arts
Institute and the Capeverdean American Community Development Center
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-y/>, in a beginning
gesture towards repair for Brown‚Äôs complicity in the gentrification and
displacement of the Cabo Verdean Fox Point community. *Kriolu Voices
Sounding* aims to build mutualistic relationships, to offer rich
conversations, and most importantly celebrate the vibrancy of the musical,
political, and scholarly life of Cabo Verdeans and Cabo Verdean Americans
in Rhode Island and surrounding areas.

Kriolu Voices Sounding is organized by Ruby Erickson and Allessandra Soares
and features collaborating artists Abel Djassi Amado, Candida Rose
Baptista, Charles (‚ÄúChachi‚Äù) Carvalho, Jose (‚ÄúDJ Big Joe‚Äù) DaMoura, Carlos
(‚ÄúCalu di Guida‚Äù) Moreno, Silas Pinto, Aminah Fernandes Pilgrim, and Perry
Lee (‚ÄúTiny‚Äù) Tavares.

*All panel discussions and workshops are free! Learn more at the link
below.*
Kriolu Voices Sounding Series Info
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-j/>




[image: A photo from a recent Black Music Lab gathering at the Granoff
Center]
BIPOC Music Mixer
6-8pm Tuesday, Feb 6
Fishman Studio at Granoff

The Black Music Lab <https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-t/> and
the Department of Music Diversity & Inclusion Action Plan committee are
proud to present the BIPOC Music Mixer, an informal mixer that brings
together the vibrant BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) music
community at Brown and beyond. All are welcome! Refreshments will be served
and attendees will have the chance to learn about future Black Music Lab
and Music DDIAP events. This event takes place in the Fishman Studio
(studio 1) at the Granoff Center for the Creative Arts.




[image: A photo of Cupid‚Äôs Arrows, a painting from 1882 by Leon Jean Basile
Perrault]
Cupid‚Äôs ArrowA Potpourri of Love Songs
3pm Saturday, Feb 10
Grant Recital Hall

Please join faculty of the Applied Music Voice Program for an afternoon of
Western Classical Art Songs in Italian, English, French, German.
Compositions include works by H.T. Burleigh, Henri Duparc, Ricky Ian
Gordon, Gioachino Rossini, Francesco Santoliquido, Robert Schumann, Undine
Smith Moore, George Walker and a new song cycle by Gregory Zavracky.
Admission is free and open to the public.
Musicians

Mariateresa Magisano, soprano
Deborah Selig, soprano
Gregory Zavracky, tenor
Fredrick Jodry, bass
Andrew Welch, piano

[image: a photo of all five musicians who will perform at this concert]




[image: A photo of Adele Faizullina]
Music Talk with Adeliia Faizullina
12pm Monday, Feb 12
Orwig 109

Composer and PhD candidate in Music & Multimedia Composition Adeliia
Faizullina leads a talk concerning her recent work. This talk is part of
the Music & Multimedia Composition (MMC) program‚Äôs Music Now colloquium
series, and it takes place on Monday, February 12 at 12pm in Orwig Music
Building, room 109. Admission is free and open to the public.
Learn More about Adeliia Faizullina
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-i/>




[image: A photo of tabla player Nitin Mitta and sitarist Srinivas Reddy]
Romantic RagasSouth Asian Music Workshopfeaturing Nitin Mitta & Srinivas
Reddy
6pm Wednesday, Feb 14
Grant Recital Hall

The Brown University Music Department presents an introductory workshop on
the classical music of South Asia, hosted by Applied Music Program
instructors Srinivas Reddy (sitar) and Nitin Mitta (tabla). Learn about
these beautiful instruments and their traditional repertoires.
Additionally, Nitin and Srinivas will discuss how they teach South Asian
music and the opportunities that exist there for Brown University students.
Admission is free and open to the public.





*Early notice of event -- get tickets before they sell out!*
[image: A photo of Meredith Monk and company in performance of Cellular
Songs]
Meredith Monk & Vocal EnsembleCellular Songs: Concert Version
7pm Saturday, Mar 2
Lindemann Performing Arts Center

Full Price: $30; Brown Faculty/Staff: $15; Students (w/ ID): $5

Recognized as one of the most unique and influential artists of our time,
composer/performer Meredith Monk presents a concert of music from her
interdisciplinary performance work, *Cellular Songs*, with the women of her
acclaimed Vocal Ensemble. A ‚Äúdeeply affecting meditation on the nature of
the biological cell as a metaphor for human society‚Äù (*Financial
Times*), *Cellular
Songs* features some of Monk‚Äôs most adventurous and daring music for the
voice to date, paired with violin, piano and keyboard. Over the course of
the evening, shimmering, multi-dimensional musical forms evoke such
biological processes as layering, replication, division, and mutation.
*Cellular
Songs* is the second part of a trilogy of music-theater works exploring our
interdependent relationship with nature, following the highly acclaimed *On
Behalf of Nature* (2013) and the recently premiered *Indra‚Äôs Net* (2023).

Meredith Monk's visit is sponsored in part by The Sara and Robert A.
Reichley Concert Fund and is a Brown Arts IGNITE event. The BAI's IGNITE
Series uplifts the spirit of artistic collaboration across Brown,
Providence, the Rhode Island region, and beyond. Ignite your creative
curiosity through this multi-year series of programs, activations,
interventions, and investigations.
Learn More + Buy Tickets
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-d/>




Follow the Brown University Department of Music
[image: Instagram]
<https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-h/>[image:
YouTube] <https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-k/>[image:
Facebook] <https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-b/>[image:
Website] <https://music.cmail20.com/t/r-l-tiiiita-buhfhuidi-n/>

Subject: Fwd: Recruiting Newsletter
Data:

From: Chen, Christopher <christopher_chen3@brown.edu>
Date: Sat, Feb 3, 2024 at 9:46‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Recruiting Newsletter
To: Adam Lalani <adam_lalani@brown.edu>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Brown University Career Center <
recruiting-brown.edu@shared1.ccsend.com>
Date: Thu, Feb 1, 2024 at 3:17‚ÄØPM
Subject: Recruiting Newsletter
To: <christopher_chen3@brown.edu>


Learn about upcoming events, opportunities, and resources!

February 1, 2024

Recruiting Spotlight - During Black History Month, we want to highlight our
Identity-based career resources available at the Career Center. The Brown
Center for Career Exploration is committed to providing all students with
the tools and resources necessary for success and acknowledge that systems
of oppression and systemic racism create inequities in access to and
opportunities in career development. We recognize that students from
diverse backgrounds may experience inequitable barriers or have unique
needs when identifying potential employers or opportunities, navigating
professional environments, or cultivating networks and connections.
Learn more here
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001H-HxDWN8SN0BZ4Evs8M1FTzm5FMp-bQZJZSOyW37BeYUQvwEiyS-0UBteEbDiP3WKQW__oLE_2XpZp-LqH_R_cLf3b2kvOEj-9BOGwxO3I70XhsGhHHgp9ahydMJefaMkVJm_q0Rst4BGLzdNaSDj5IHMh5LCBQ-NT-Smm-jWYLOvy7D3GcPxJTvs0F2mHs-ooXrYE8FV5BdO9j6VpDZ-JR1wu6Ft4Fd&c=wwXCQCR8G_FI1_N3e2nvTCLl75-kl862hLJyWkesbsZOXm4c6OAiMA==&ch=Oo8y7rHhAJNtRq24kZzSV-ucpCDw2LrpTdCTMl9CFAZCUhpTp_u5jQ==>

Enrich Scholars - Career Workshop Series

Dates: 2/26/24, 5pm PST; ongoing every

4th Monday of the month


We have launched our Enrich Career Workshop Series, hosting virtual
professional development workshops for Scholars. We share tips and tricks
on how Scholars can best utilize their LinkedIn to support them on the
internship/job hunt. We still have Corporate Partners Hiring for the
following opportunities! Amica is looking to hire 2024 Grads for full-time
roles in the following fields: Finance, Organizational
Leadership/Psychology, and anyone who's interested in exploring Insurance
(open to all major/industry interests!) H&R Block is hiring 2024 Grads for
full-time roles in Software Engineering! Comcast NBC Universal is hiring
2025 Grads for their summer 2024 Finance Internship Program. We encourage
any students who may benefit from any of these above opportunities to join
Enrich TODAY to gain support and access to these opportunities.


Learn more and apply here
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001H-HxDWN8SN0BZ4Evs8M1FTzm5FMp-bQZJZSOyW37BeYUQvwEiyS-0UHciPQk6fmFFA6PPA4DAhSRRqKkRc83Y9iZUbegk6f4QZUpWwpifiM-3r6kH6bFtRgrgpIopvyNW0lpVCY6aB9J6sjjLsM6gGsdHyZpVZ4uX_YXRTqcbY0=&c=wwXCQCR8G_FI1_N3e2nvTCLl75-kl862hLJyWkesbsZOXm4c6OAiMA==&ch=Oo8y7rHhAJNtRq24kZzSV-ucpCDw2LrpTdCTMl9CFAZCUhpTp_u5jQ==>

Wolf Trap - Virtual Information Session

Date: 2/21/24, 12pm-1pm EST


Join Wolf Trap for an info session to learn how a paid summer internship or
apprenticeship at Wolf Trap can provide skills that will lead towards a
gratifying career in communications, development, education, IT, technical
theatre, stage management and more! Applications are currently open and
being considered on a rolling basis. Applications will not be considered
after March 1.


Learn more and register here
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001H-HxDWN8SN0BZ4Evs8M1FTzm5FMp-bQZJZSOyW37BeYUQvwEiyS-0S2bxbHkMIHRBRgkQjP5Sloqm3Bf82-BCgXcavQAcA4fgfK8foQb64vXkLkK4BRhECuj8dvjHfvafyVQwxwYaBD2M0Hp_EIrSaWfch6Qawm5ToIPnB7PCJofMGau14pNBN_-FE7Ny8N3__f91bn9ebRDnKOhKe1UsQJQ8QbejvM1MUR6JyU6k6ecBR32EFJJFQ==&c=wwXCQCR8G_FI1_N3e2nvTCLl75-kl862hLJyWkesbsZOXm4c6OAiMA==&ch=Oo8y7rHhAJNtRq24kZzSV-ucpCDw2LrpTdCTMl9CFAZCUhpTp_u5jQ==>

Regent Craft - Connecting Talent with Opportunities in Blue Tech

Date: 2/2/24, 12pm-2:30pm EST


The Nelson Center is partnering with the engineering department to host an
event with Regent Craft. Join us on February 2, 2024, from 12 PM to 1:00 PM
ET, followed by breakout rooms and a group Q&A from 1:00 - 2:30 PM at the
Liz Lange Lecture Hall, Brown University's Nelson Center for
Entrepreneurship, for an exclusive event hosted by REGENT.

This gathering aims to bridge connections between REGENT and Brown
University's vibrant entrepreneurial ecosystem. Students can learn about
REGENT‚Äôs founding story, evolving technology, progress, and goals, and also
explore full-time and internship opportunities in business and technical
fields.


Learn more and register here
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001H-HxDWN8SN0BZ4Evs8M1FTzm5FMp-bQZJZSOyW37BeYUQvwEiyS-0S2bxbHkMIHRJ4EouLGEkO3onfkPMcKxP5fab7LleyilDFTO-pf-ECHTyVhJbZxWmK4F_0fJg_rzL3eaRkub9fFXETeFx_AuN7LxczKhoTVvFrauosv61d47vauHk9MZRfGTXPYnE0Lx0Ut2882uzFcpNMRJiy-jP1oV9Fm5WLofhANjNxPXHT7x3f-f1soJ9ho8Hpzqaev_&c=wwXCQCR8G_FI1_N3e2nvTCLl75-kl862hLJyWkesbsZOXm4c6OAiMA==&ch=Oo8y7rHhAJNtRq24kZzSV-ucpCDw2LrpTdCTMl9CFAZCUhpTp_u5jQ==>

Infosys - MakeHarvard 2024

Date: 2/3-2/4/24


The annual MakeHarvard engineering makeathon will return this February for
its seventh year. Competing teams at our 2024 event will have the chance to
win awesome prizes and network with engineers all around the world. Current
undergraduate and graduate students can apply to MakeHarvard! We accept
students from all academic backgrounds. Many of our competitors have
experience with mechanical, electrical, or computer engineering. This year
the event will be in Harvard's newly-built Science and Engineering Complex
in Allston (address: 150 Western Ave, Boston, MA 02134). Meals are
catered/provided all weekend, plus Insomnia Cookies and access to Harvard‚Äôs
engineering facilities (3D printers, lathes, etc.) Best Use of AI category
winners will win Amazon Firesticks and a fast-track fast track
consideration for the Infosys InStep summer internship program.

For questions, please contact: Bradley Baltz
bradleybaltz@college.harvard.edu.


Learn more and apply here
<https://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?f=001H-HxDWN8SN0BZ4Evs8M1FTzm5FMp-bQZJZSOyW37BeYUQvwEiyS-0S2bxbHkMIHRbCwOJsQp0q7w0ANQsSkAqU90BOIBQABvoB1YHHmPwXFdXo3KXVS6nilN6WhDmUNrFHRSokOwff9MDUWxn37oiw==&c=wwXCQCR8G_FI1_N3e2nvTCLl75-kl862hLJyWkesbsZOXm4c6OAiMA==&ch=Oo8y7rHhAJNtRq24kZzSV-ucpCDw2LrpTdCTMl9CFAZCUhpTp_u5jQ==>

Oliver Wyman - 2024 Women‚Äôs Leadership Series and our Diversity Leadership
Summit

Deadline for Women's Leadership Series: 2/4/24, 11:59pm EST

Deadline for Diversity Leadership Summit: 3/10/24, 11:59pm EST


Join us for an in-person 2-day program. Connect with leaders at our firm
through professional development workshops, network with other students and
develop strong case skills through interactive sessions. These programs are
Oliver Wyman hosted and are targeted at undergraduate students at the
sophomore and junior level. During the program, we help students take a
deep dive into consulting, go through case prep and network with Oliver
Wyman leaders! Attendees will be invited to interview for full-time or
internship roles.

Impact Agenda Podcast - Podcast Created by Princeton Students


In this podcast, we chat with guests across diverse industries and globally
who are creatively integrating impact into their careers. Our mission is to
shed light on the diverse career paths available and how individuals have
made a positive impact in their respective fields. We believe that The
Impact Agenda can serve as a valuable resource for your students as they
navigate their career options and seek to make a meaningful impact in their
chosen fields. In our previous episodes, we've had the privilege of hosting
distinguished guests, including the Vice President of Social Impact at
LinkedIn, the CEO of Morgan Health (J.P. Morgan's $250M Healthcare VC
branch), the Director of the Peace Corps, and the founder of the Hong Kong
Youth Arts Foundation, among many others. These conversations offer
valuable insights and inspiration for students looking to explore career
paths that align with their values and aspirations.


Season 3 of our podcast has just launched, featuring Mumtaz Ahmed, VP of
Social Impact at Rosewood Hotel Group. You can get a taste of our content
by listening to our 15-minute Season 2 special recap episode here: Podcast
Recap Episode.


Learn more and listen here

U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) - Hiring Webinar

Date: 2/7/2024, 2pm EST


For job seekers who have never applied for a federal job before, no
problem! This event is for them and will cover all things hiring at EPA,
including:


-How to navigate USAJOBS.gov and the federal hiring process,

-Making their application as competitive as possible,

-Unique hiring pathways available for students and recent grads,

-And a LIVE Q&A section where our hiring specialists will answer questions!


From tackling the climate crisis to advancing environmental justice, what
happens here changes our world. There has never been a more critical moment
to join our team and be the one who protects human health and the
environment.


If you have any questions, connect with our EPA Careers Team at
careers@epa.gov.

neurosurgery.

NY-RaMP for Diversifying the National Biology Workforce through New York
Trans-disciplinary BioSciences is a paid one-year research and scientific
career development program. Recent college graduates experience laboratory
immersion in biology and cell signaling by performing independent research
with a team of active scientists. Chosen postbaccalaureate scholars
participate in a trans-disciplinary cell, molecular, and bioinformatics
learning experience that begins with six weeks of ‚Äúscience boot camp‚Äù skill
development at Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory DNA Learning Center NYC and
the Hunter College Belfer Research Laboratories. Scholars are then matched
with a mentoring team at the Hunter College Belfer Research Alliance in New
York City.

Subject: Fwd: SorinFest: Sorin Istrail's 70th Birthday Conference
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Lopes, Meg <meglopes@brown.edu>
Date: Thu, Aug 3, 2023 at 8:02‚ÄØAM
Subject: SorinFest: Sorin Istrail's 70th Birthday Conference
To: <ccmb-gradstudents@listserv.brown.edu>, <
ccmb-postdocs@listserv.brown.edu>, compbiodug <compbiodug@brown.edu>
Cc: Alden Bumstead <alden_bumstead@brown.edu>, Ramachandran, Sohini <
sramachandran@brown.edu>, 164angell3rdfloor <164angell3rdfloor@brown.edu>


On behalf of the program committee, I am delighted to invite you to
attend *SorinFest:
phase transitions in computer science and computational biology*, a meeting
to celebrate Professor Sorin Istrail‚Äôs 70th birthday. SorinFest will be
held on *October 6th and 7th 2023* (Friday and Saturday of the Columbus Day
weekend) at Brown University, Providence, Rhode Island.


A list of 44 speakers that have tentatively accepted to attend is included
below. This list includes leaders that have inspired Sorin‚Äôs work, as well
as collaborators and students who have been inspired by his work. We hope
to have a collegial setting with ample time for discussions among the
attendees. Our preliminary schedule runs from 10 a.m. until 6 p.m. on
Friday, followed by a conference dinner, and 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturday,
followed by a birthday dinner.

Please let us know if you are able to attend.
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScKqGCH3fjdHVN_tnFuXg66vZUqxm8ZJfWI-UWScbcJPUk7PQ/viewform>
 More information will be forthcoming.


On behalf of the SorinFest Program Committee:



*Bjarni V. Halld√≥rsson* *(Chair, Head of Sequence Analysis, deCODE
genetics, and Associate Professor of Biomedical Engineering, Reykjav√≠k
University)*

*Derek Aguiar **(Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Engineering,
University of Connecticut)*

*Suzanne Alden **(Grants and Financial Manager, Department of Computer
Science, Brown University)*

*Vineet Bafna** (Professor of Computer Science and Engineering, University
of California San Diego)*

*Meg Lopes* *(Events and Outreach Coordinator, Center for Computational
Molecular Biology, Data Science Institute, Brown University) *

*Russell Schwartz* *(Professor and Head, Computational Biology Department,
Carnegie Mellon University)*



*List of speakers:*

Craig Venter

Bonnie Berger

Subject: Fwd: Production Skills Series: Audio and Lighting
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: SAO Office <sao@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Jan 30, 2024 at 12:02‚ÄØPM
Subject: Production Skills Series: Audio and Lighting
To:


Dear Student Leaders,

This semester the Student Activities Office will be hosting a series of
introductory hands-on skills sessions open to all students - no experience,
no registration required! However, these sessions are particularly relevant
for students who anticipate using A/V equipment in any of spaces below.

*Event Audio Package How To‚Äôs*
Have you requested an audio rental package from Event Operations for your
event but don‚Äôt know a thing about microphones or sound consoles? This
workshop will give you hands-on experience with the basics of sound
playback, using and mixing microphones, and more.

February 6, 2023 Petteruti Lounge, Campus Center 201   6-7:30pm
March 4, 2023 Petteruti Lounge, Campus Center 201   6-7:30pm


*Alumnae Hall Theatrical Lighting Introduction*
This hands-on session introduces the basics of creating, recording, and
running light cues for student group events and performances.  No
experience is necessary!  All sessions will be held in Alumnae Auditorium.

February 5, 2023 5-7pm
February 12, 2023 6-8pm
March 18, 2023 6-8pm


*Alumnae Hall Audio Introduction*
During this hands-on session you‚Äôll learn how to run playback audio cues,
mix in handheld microphones as well as operate the wireless intercom
headset system.  No experience necessary!

February 5, 2023 7-8pm
February 12, 2023 5-6pm
March 18, 2023 5-6pm


*Audio/Visual Opportunities in The Underground*
These sessions are designed to introduce event organizers to The
Underground‚Äôs built in sound and projection systems and how to get the most
out of the experience.  Both sessions will be held in The Underground.

February 26, 2023 6-7pm
April 2, 2023 6-7pm

Please feel free to reach out to Jen Lucero, jen_lucero@brown.edu, with any
questions.

Best,
SAO

*Student Activities Office <https://studentactivities.brown.edu/>*
Stephen Robert '62 Campus Center
<https://studentactivities.brown.edu/facilities/campus-center>(Faunce House)
75 Waterman St, Providence, RI 02912
Tel: 401-863-2341

From: Brown KASA <kasa@brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Sep 1, 2023 at 9:51‚ÄØAM
Subject: [KASA] Welcome Back Chingoos üëãüá∞üá∑!

View this email in your browser
<https://mailchi.mp/cd4ac800b301/kasa-welcome-back-gb-meeting-game-night-freshman-rep-info-session-13557875?e=626ef84ed6>

*KASA Chingoos! *

Whether it be in Provy, the motherland üá∞üá∑, home, or somewhere far,
we hope you all had a BLAST üöÄ this summer!! We missed y'all SO MUCH.

To get this UNRIVALED year of KASA up and going üèéÔ∏è üí®, we have a few
things we wanted to put out there:

   - The time has come to prepare for our annual BIG SIB/LITTLE SIB GB
   event! *SIGN UP to become a BIG (**‚òÄÔ∏è **bae)* *here*
   <https://brownkasa.us10.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bd44f9fa9a4d1cbc3a2f067b9&id=6164450886&e=626ef84ed6>
A-S-A-P
   (üéµ hurry up, don't be lazy üéµ)! It is due *Sunday, September 10th.* This
   form will allow us to match you with a little based on your selected
   preferences. Right ... right ... we've all heard this before BUT ...
   drumroll please ü•Å ... this year we're going to have FAMILIES üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶
   in addition to sibling pairs, so we'll be placing 3-4 sibling pairs in a
   kasa family!



   - KASA will be at the *ACTIVITIES FAIR üé™ *on *Thursday, September 7th
   from 5-8 pm.* Come out to simply say hi üëã or meet new friends!



   - Want to be better informed about KASA events, receive possible career
   advice, or simply have general questions about KASA?! Well look no further

   <https://brownkasa.us10.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bd44f9fa9a4d1cbc3a2f067b9&id=4d4a027965&e=626ef84ed6>

We can't wait to see all of your faces on campus soon! Make sure to

of KASA!! üá∞üá∑


*Love,  KASA E-Board *üòä

Subject: Fwd: Skate Your Heart Out with CCB ‚õ∏
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Klatsky, Nicholas <nicholas_klatsky@brown.edu>
Date: Sat, Feb 3, 2024 at 9:34‚ÄØAM
Subject: Fwd: Skate Your Heart Out with CCB ‚õ∏
To: <hackatbrown1@gmail.com>




---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Class Coordinating Board <classboard@brown.edu>
Date: Wed, Jan 31, 2024 at 3:04‚ÄØPM
Subject: Skate Your Heart Out with CCB ‚õ∏
To: <community.classboard.junior@lists.brown.edu>



Hello, Class of 2025!

We hope you are having a fantastic beginning to your semester! While you
are filling out your Valentine‚Äôs Day Goody Grams (*ordering form linked *
*here* <https://forms.gle/kxjLxTk44ggLZWPX8>*, in case you missed it!*), we
are here to announce another really exciting event to be on the lookout
for: *Ice Skating at BankNewport City Center!*

‚õ∏Ice Skating: BankNewport City Center ‚õ∏


Make sure to come out and enjoy Ice Skating on Saturday, February 10th from
12 pm - 4 pm! There will be light refreshments as well! Make sure you wear
some warm clothes, including gloves and a hat! We are so excited to see you
there!

‚ùÑÔ∏èThere is NO PRE-REGISTRATION for this event!!‚ùÑÔ∏è

That‚Äôs right, no sign-ups needed! Instead, tickets will be distributed to
the first 100 juniors or seniors that arrive at BankNewport City Center
with their Brown ID during the 12 pm - 2 pm skating block, and then 100
additional tickets will be distributed for the 2 pm - 4 pm block, so get
there ASAP! Even if you are not the first 100 to arrive, you can still get
a discounted ticket to skate with our friends with a Brown ID.

Hope to see you there!

Lots of love,

ü§éYour 2025 Class Coordinating Boardü§é

Jazz Carlson, President

Ivy Zhuang, Vice-President

Christine Wu, Secretary

Swaraj Agarwal, Treasurer

Minnie Zhang, Public Relations Officer

Kelly Wei, Community Outreach Officer

IG: @brownccb25 <https://instagram.com/brownccb25?r=nametag>

Website: www.brownccb.org

CCB is committed to fostering an inclusive, anti-discriminatory environment
in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, regardless
of any identities they may hold. CCB prohibits harassment and retaliation
by its membership and leadership alike. CCB encourages its members to voice
concerns and commits to engaging in effective and equitable conflict
management.

Subject: Fwd: BCC Fall Recruitment Information
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Brown Consulting Club <brownconsultingclub@brown.edu>
Date: Mon, Sep 4, 2023 at 9:08‚ÄØPM
Subject: BCC Fall Recruitment Information
To: <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


Hello BCC!

Welcome back to campus! We hope everyone had a great summer. BCC will be
opening fall recruitment soon and we hope to see you all apply. Perks of
BCC include a tight knit community, access to consulting resources and
mentors, exclusive networking sessions and office visits with firms, and
invaluable hands on consulting experience with real clients.

Please see below for our full fall recruitment timeline. If you have any
questions, feel free to reach out to us via email or find us at the
activities fair on Thursday. *Please note that attendance at at least one
info session is mandatory for all applicants.*

You will also have the opportunity to schedule 15 minute coffee chats with
our e-board members. This is completely optional and has no bearing on your
application, but is a great opportunity to learn more about the club and
meet some of our members.To apply, please visit brownconsultingclub.com/join
<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=9e0fa76098&e=3e25b0d712>
to
find our application and recruitment timeline. You can also schedule
e-board coffee chats on that page. We look forward to seeing you at our
info sessions and reviewing your applications!

Subject: Fwd: üåÉ A Night (Club) on College Hill (ANOCH) üåô Save the Date!
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Class Coordinating Board <classboard@brown.edu>
Date: Wed, Sep 27, 2023 at 2:26‚ÄØPM
Subject: üåÉ A Night (Club) on College Hill (ANOCH) üåô Save the Date!
To: <community.classboard.junior@lists.brown.edu>, <
community.classboard.senior@lists.brown.edu>, <
community.classboard.firstyear@lists.brown.edu>, <
community.classboard.sophomore@lists.brown.edu>


Brown University Class Coordinating Board cordially invites you to:

üåü A Night (Club) On College Hill üåô

Brown University‚Äôs Annual Fall Campus Dance

Date: Saturday, October 14th, 2023

Time: 10 pm - 1 am

Location: Ruth Simmons Quad

Dress: Whatever you feel comfortable in! Going-out attire encouraged!

Light refreshments will be served.

CCB is excited to announce that A Night (Club) On College Hill (ANOCH), Brown‚Äôs
campus-wide fall dance, will be taking place on Saturday, October 14th! Make
sure you save the date and watch out for more details to come.

We will have a photographer as well as a DJ and a live student band,
MOODRING! So make sure you bring comfortable shoes to dance on the grass as
there won‚Äôt be a dance floor.

Important Ticket/Event Details:

   -

   There is a capacity limit for the tent and there will be no waitlist at
   the door. Once the Eventbrite link opens on Friday, 10/6 (we will send
   you another email when it does) get your ticket quickly as we expect to
   sell out.
   -

   You can only get one ticket for yourself.
   -

   Only Eventbrite registrations with @brown.edu emails will work as viable
   tickets. Make sure the name you sign up with matches your Brown ID. Your
   Brown ID is needed for admission day of.
   -

   Only Brown University Undergraduates are allowed in the event. No guests
   are allowed.
   -

   There is no re-entry to the event.
   -

   Doors close at 12am.


Please feel free to submit more queries or concerns via our general
feedback form
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfY-0C67Ud0n8ZDMeipf3XLC560v-RLxZ7cS1rWh4_kCwtoaw/viewform>
, and we will do our best to get back to you.

Cheers,

Your Class Coordinating Board

Website: www.brownccb.org

CCB is committed to fostering an inclusive, anti-discriminatory environment
in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, regardless
of any identities they may hold.  CCB is committed to accessibility. To
request special services, accommodations or assistance for any events,
please contact classboard@brown.edu as far in advance as possible.

Subject: Fwd: TOMORROW: CS Research Open House!
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: MURAs <mindy_kim@brown.edu>
Date: Mon, Oct 2, 2023 at 9:00‚ÄØAM
Subject: TOMORROW: CS Research Open House!
To: adam lalani <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


View this email in your browser
<https://mailchi.mp/ba43525aa037/mura-cs-research-open-house-reminder-17079860?e=e014c48a02>
TOMORROW: CS Research Open House!
Hi everyone!

Quick reminder that the 8th Annual Fall CS Research Open House will be held
*TOMORROW* *5:30**-7:30PM EDT* in the *CIT 3rd floor atrium* *(or Zoom 936
2236 4018 for the intro presentations at the beginning, around 5:30-6:15)*!

Be sure to fill out our RSVP form here
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=df3d9a3f90&e=e014c48a02>,
and check out our detailed list of participating groups at
https://tinyurl.com/csopenhouse-23
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=bf5b356836&e=e014c48a02>.


This event is an accessible way to learn about Brown CS research, no matter
what year, concentration, or classes you're in. This is the perfect
opportunity to explore your interests and get involved!

We'll start with brief introductions from each group, which will be
livestreamed and recorded. Afterwards, we will open up the floor for
students to mingle with labs. You'll have a chance to meet the research
labs, chat about ongoing work with professors and students, and learn how
to engage in CS research at Brown.

*Food will be served!*

As always, reach out to us at mura@cs.brown.edu if you have any questions.
See you there!

- The MURAs (Mindy and Anna)
[image: Email] <mura@cs.brown.edu>
*More questions? Email us at:*
mura@cs.brown.edu

To:


Hi friends,


*Brown Consulting Club* (BCC) and *Brown Investment Group* (BIG) will be
hosting a panel on the topic of *Consulting vs. Finance* this coming
Thursday 11/9 at 8pm. If you're considering which area to recruit for/gain
experience in or just curious to learn more about these topics, this panel

who have experience across both consulting and finance, and gain some
insight into the similarities and differences between them.

Location: *Friedman 201*

Subject: Fwd: MURA October Newsletter
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: MURAs <mindy_kim@brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Oct 6, 2023 at 8:29‚ÄØAM
Subject: MURA October Newsletter
To: adam lalani <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


View this email in your browser
<https://mailchi.mp/22fcf54480af/mura-april-2023-newsletter-17081388?e=e014c48a02>
October Newsletter from your MURAs

Hello everyone!

Hope you are all settling into the school year as we are about two weeks
away from the mid-semester point! Just as a reminder, our office hours are
on *Mondays 3-5pm in CIT 304* - feel free to stop by with any questions
about CS research. Also, check out our *webpage*: http://ur.cs.brown.edu/
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=707fbf7ca9&e=e014c48a02>,
which has more information and resources.

In this newsletter, we will cover the following:

   -

   CS Research Open House Recap
   -

   Apply to be a MURA
   -

   SPRINT/UTRA

Always feel free to contact us at mura@cs.brown.edu if you have any
questions!

- The MURAs (Mindy Kim and Anna Wei)
CS Research Open House Recap

Thanks to everyone who came to the open house on Tuesday Oct 3! We hope you
all had a good time learning about Brown CS research and exploring your
interests!

Here are the event materials (please access with Brown email):

   -

   *Program:
   <https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=475606e865&e=e014c48a02>https://tinyurl.com/csopenhouse-23
   <https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=66d2904487&e=e014c48a02>*
   -

   *Intro Presentation Slides
   <https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=1d2f4230d2&e=e014c48a02>*
   -

   *Intro Presentation Recording
   <https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=e0d0a73385&e=e014c48a02>*

We'd also appreciate any feedback via this 2-minute anonymous feedback form:
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=884438c0ab&e=e014c48a02>
https://forms.gle/duP4Y69kajPGupv2A
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=95d008831b&e=e014c48a02>
.
Apply to be a MURA!

The MURAs (Meta Undergraduate Research Assistants) are looking to *hire an
additional student to the team*. If you are interested in coordinating
events and connecting undergrads with faculty and labs at Brown CS, this is
the right place for you!

This paid position will officially start in *Fall 2024*, and you may stay
on until you graduate.

All interested students can find more information through our application
form here
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=0bc4f1b752&e=e014c48a02>.
Apply by *Monday, October 23rd by 11:59 PM*.
SPRINT/UTRA

Karen T. Romer Undergraduate Teaching and Research Awards (UTRAs) support
Brown students collaborating with Brown faculty on research and teaching
projects during the summer or the academic year.

The Spring 2024 SPRINT|UTRA application and faculty-listed opportunities
will be *available on October 6, 2023* and the application will *close on
October 23, 2023 at 12:00 PM EST*.

You can find more information at
https://www.brown.edu/academics/college/fellowships/utra/
<https://brown.us20.list-manage.com/track/click?u=bcc48ebedfea41b4f2089c070&id=673b8a32e8&e=e014c48a02>
.
*Fall is here :)*
[image: Email] <mura@cs.brown.edu>
*More questions? Email us at:*
mura@cs.brown.edu

Subject: Fwd: BRC General Information & E-board Application
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Brown Research Club <researchclub@brown.edu>
Date: Sun, Oct 8, 2023 at 12:41‚ÄØPM
Subject: BRC General Information & E-board Application
To: <BRC_GENBODY@listserv.brown.edu>


Hi all,

Welcome to Brown Research Club! We hope that you‚Äôve had a wonderful summer
and shopping period.

You are receiving this email because you have indicated interest in getting
involved with the BRC. We are looking for new e-board members for our
Events, Journal, and Development committees ‚Äî you can read more about each
of them on the application
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSczz17PIO0AWfWf4fpAD0BDtyjrzwUxXhjVjtHiefp_cVhTVw/viewform?usp=sf_link
to help you decide which would be the best fit for you. We're looking
forward to reading your applications, and if you have any questions
whatsoever, please do not hesitate to reach out! The deadline for
application is 15th October at 11:59 PM.

If you are interested in receiving research-related materials stay tuned.
We will be sending updates shortly, so please encourage anyone who may be
interested to sign up for our Listserv:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdkw30AepZOAlKLDXCvHwdz8Kjbx3lbalGX5XAo5WIJN7V-NA/viewform?usp=sf_link

We are so excited to see you soon!

Warmly,
BRC Co-presidents
--

<https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/r/eventedit?text=Language+Instructed+Reinforcement+Learning+for+Human-AI+Coordination&dates=20231017T200000Z/20231017T210000Z&details=Hengyuan+Hu%0A%0A%0A++Ph%E2%80%8B.D+%E2%80%8BStudent+at+Stanford+University%0A%0A%0A++Tuesday,+October+17%E2%80%8B,+2023+at+4:00+PM%0A%0A%0A++%E2%80%8BRoom+368%E2%80%8B+(CIT+-+3rd+floor)%0A%0A%0A++%0A%0A%0A++%0A++++One+of+the+fundamental+quests+of+AI+is+to+produce+agents+that%0A++++coordinate+well+with+humans.+This+problem+is+challenging,+especially%0A++++in+domains+that+lack+high+quality+human+behavioral+data,+because%0A++++multi-agent+reinforcement+learning+(RL)+often+converges+to+different%0A++++equilibria+from+the+ones+that+humans+prefer.+We+propose+a+novel%0A++++framework,+instructRL,+that+enables+humans+to+specify+what+kind+of%0A++++strategies+they+expect+from+their+AI+partners+through+natural+language%0A++++instructions.+We+use+pretrained+large+language+models+to+generate+a%0A++++prior+policy+conditioned+on+the+human+instruction+and+use+the+prior+to%0A++++regularize+the+RL+objective.+This+leads+to+the+RL+agent+converging+to%0A++++equilibria+that+are+aligned+with+human+preferences.+We+show+that%0A++++instructRL+converges+to+human-like+policies+that+satisfy+the+given%0A++++instructions+in+a+proof-of-concept+environment+as+well+as+the%0A++++challenging+Hanabi+benchmark.+Finally,+we+show+that+knowing+the%0A++++language+instruction+significantly+boosts+human-AI+coordination%0A++++performance+in+human+evaluations+in+Hanabi.%0A++++%0A++++Hengyuan+Hu+is+a+PhD+student+at+Stanford+University+advised+by+Dorsa%0A++++Sadigh.+He+is+interested+in+robotics,+human-AI+coordination+and%0A++++reinforcement+learning.+Before+starting+his+PhD,+he+was+a+research%0A++++engineer+at+FAIR+(Meta+AI)+working+on+coordination+in+multi-agent%0A++++environments,+such+as+Hanabi+and+Diplomacy.%0A++%0A++%0A++++%0A++%0A++%0A++++%0A++++++%E2%80%8BHost:+Professor+Amy+Greenwald&location=Watson+Center+for+Information+Technology+(CIT),+368&trp=false&sprop&sprop=name:>


*Language Instructed Reinforcement Learning for Human-AI Coordination*

One of the fundamental quests of AI is to produce agents that
coordinate well with humans. This problem is challenging, especially
in domains that lack high quality human behavioral data, because
multi-agent reinforcement learning (RL) often converges to different
equilibria from the ones that humans prefer. We propose a novel
framework, instructRL, that enables humans to specify what kind of
strategies they expect from their AI partners through natural language
instructions. We use pretrained large language models to generate a
prior policy conditioned on the human instruction and use the prior to
regularize the RL objective. This leads to the RL agent converging to
equilibria that are aligned with human preferences. We show that
instructRL converges to human-like policies that satisfy the given
instructions in a proof-of-concept environment as well as the
challenging Hanabi benchmark. Finally, we show that knowing the
language instruction significantly boosts human-AI coordination
performance in human evaluations in Hanabi.

Hengyuan Hu is a PhD student at Stanford University advised by Dorsa
Sadigh. He is interested in robotics, human-AI coordination and
reinforcement learning. Before starting his PhD, he was a research
engineer at FAIR (Meta AI) working on coordination in multi-agent
environments, such as Hanabi and Diplomacy.

Host: Professor Amy Greenwald


_______________________________________________
The Computer Science Department is located at 115 Waterman St., Providence,
RI. Our Calendar of Events at http://www.cs.brown.edu/events lists all of
our talks.

If you would like to be removed from (or added to) our seminar mailing
list, please send email containing your request to mailto:
talks-owner@lists.cs.brown.edu.

We'd very much appreciate your forwarding these announcements to colleagues
who may also have an interest. Thanks for your cooperation.

Data:

Subject: [e-glamor] Fwd: Annie Liang's Monday econ theory talk, an econ
take on transfer learning
To: <e-glamor@lists.cs.brown.edu>

thank you!

---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Jason Hartline <jasonhartline@gmail.com>
Date: Fri, Oct 27, 2023 at 4:35‚ÄØPM
Subject: Annie Liang's Monday econ theory talk, an econ take on transfer
learning
To: Greenwald, Amy <amy_greenwald@brown.edu>
Cc: Annie Liang <liang.annie.h@gmail.com>


Hi Amy,

Annie shared with me her title and abstract for the Monday talk.  I know
this work and think it would be of interest to folks doing machine learning
in CS.  Also, CCing Annie in case you want to get in touch.  Have fun with
out me!

Jason

---


Title: The Transfer Performance of Economic Models (joint with Isaiah
Andrews, Drew Fudenberg, Lihua Lei, and Chaofeng Wu)

Abstract: Economists often estimate models using data from a particular
domain, e.g. estimating risk preferences in a particular subject pool or
for a specific class of lotteries. Whether a model's predictions
extrapolate well across domains depends on whether the estimated model has
captured generalizable structure. We provide a tractable formulation for
this "out-of-domain" prediction problem and define the transfer error of a
model  based on how well it performs on data from a new domain. We derive
finite-sample forecast intervals that are guaranteed to cover realized
transfer errors with a user-selected probability when domains are iid, and
use these intervals to compare the transferability of economic models and
black box algorithms for predicting certainty equivalents.  We find that in
this application, the black box algorithms we consider outperform standard
economic models when estimated and tested on data from the same domain,
but the economic models generalize across domains better than the
black-box algorithms do.

Subject: Fwd: [e-glamor] Reading group
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Prakash, Arjun <arjun_prakash@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Oct 31, 2023 at 8:47‚ÄØAM
Subject: [e-glamor] Reading group
To: <e-glamor@lists.cs.brown.edu>, Benjamin Spiegel <
benjamin_spiegel@brown.edu>


Good morning everyone!

We have a slightly different kind of talk today.

We will hear from Ben Spiegal on his work on natural language.

See you this afternoon!

Room 368 at 4pm

Zoom https://brown.zoom.us/j/98650778922

Cheers,
A

Abstract:
We introduce RLang, a domain-specific language (DSL) for communicating
domain knowledge to an RL agent. Unlike existing RL DSLs that ground to
\textit{single} elements of a decision-making formalism (e.g., the reward
function or policy), RLang can specify information about every element of a
Markov decision process. We define precise syntax and grounding semantics
for RLang, and provide a parser that grounds RLang programs to an
algorithm-agnostic \textit{partial} world model and policy that can be
exploited by an RL agent. We provide a series of example RLang programs
demonstrating how different RL methods can exploit the resulting knowledge,
encompassing model-free and model-based tabular algorithms, policy gradient
and value-based methods, hierarchical approaches, and deep methods.

Our next meeting will be this Monday in the Metcalf Research Building
Auditorium (across from the SciLi). From 8pm to 9pm, the Consumer group
will be pitching International Workplace Group (IWG: LN).

For those who are interested, the written form of the pitch can be found
here:
https://www.symmetry.dk/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/IWG-Investment-Report-by-Itai-Parnes.pdf
. It is, of course, not required to read the paper before the meeting, but
it will provide more in-depth information on IWG than what can be conveyed
in a more time-limited presentation.


Best,

Subject: Fwd: [ipp-annc] REMINDER: Event Tomorrow
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Gaxiola Lopez, Herbert <herbert_gaxiola_lopez@brown.edu>
Date: Mon, Nov 6, 2023 at 4:16‚ÄØPM
Subject: [ipp-annc] REMINDER: Event Tomorrow
To: <ipp-annc@lists.cs.brown.edu>


Hello everyone, this is a reminder that we will be having an event
tomorrow! Make sure to RSVP
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeTkMFgelysT6WcUQGX13uqS5WaSH_Q_DZF-OPqLAFtno3iCg/viewform?usp=sf_link>
so we can get a sense of how many people are attending virtually!


Join us on *November 7th , 2023*, as we delve into the fascinating world of
computer science and its applications in drug discovery, with our esteemed
speaker, Dr. Jade Shi from Revolution Medicines. This event will take place
virtually on Zoom <https://brown.zoom.us/j/9805212049> from *5-6pm!*

With an educational background from completing his doctorate at Stanford
University and
bachelors in Caltech, coupled with his extensive experience at Revolution
Medicines, Dr. Shi
brings a wealth of knowledge and insights to this session.

*Here is some additional info about RevMed and the session agenda:*

Revolution Medicines is a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company focused
on developing
innovative drugs to treat cancer and other serious diseases by harnessing
the power of frontier
oncology and other novel target discovery. The company is committed to
disrupting the status
quo in cancer treatment by targeting the molecular drivers of the disease,
with a particular
focus on RAS, a family of proteins that play a key role in the development
of many cancers.
Dr. Shi will provide an in-depth overview of the drug discovery process,
the role of
bioinformatics, and the use of machine learning in predicting synthetic
lethality and QSAR
modeling. He will also share valuable lessons he has learned from his
interdisciplinary
background in chemistry, biology, and computer science, emphasizing the
importance of this
combination in the biotech industry.


*Agenda:*
1. Introduction to drug discovery
2. Bioinformatics overview
3. Differential gene expression and downstream analyses
4. Synthetic lethality prediction with machine learning
5. Computational chemistry overview
6. Virtual screening of drugs
7. QSAR modeling with machine learning
8. Necessary elements for successful machine learning


We look forward to seeing you there!

--

<https://mailtrack.io/trace/link/cc705af429933ff358e47279bbf8369356c20dab?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.brown.edu%2F&userId=7118577&signature=2f709598cefbdecb>

Subject: Fwd: [e-glamor] Glamour Lab Talk - Yu Cheng
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Prakash, Arjun <arjun_prakash@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Nov 7, 2023 at 8:50‚ÄØAM
Subject: [e-glamor] Glamour Lab Talk - Yu Cheng
To: <e-glamor@lists.cs.brown.edu>
Cc: Yu Cheng <yu_cheng@brown.edu>


Good morning everyone,

Today we will have Yu Cheng presenting to our group!

Yu will be presenting his recent work on turn taking games.

https://cs.brown.edu/people/ycheng79/#

When: 4pm
Where: CIT 368

Join Zoom Meeting
https://brown.zoom.us/j/98650778922
Meeting ID: 986 5077 8922

See you this afternoon!
A

*************************
Efficiently Solving Turn-Taking Stochastic Games with Extensive-Form
Correlation


*Hanrui Zhang, Yu Cheng, Vincent Conitzer. EC 2023.*

We study equilibrium computation with extensive-form correlation in
two-player turn-taking stochastic games. Our main results are two-fold: (1)
We give an algorithm for computing a Stackelberg extensive-form correlated
equilibrium (SEFCE), which runs in time polynomial in the size of the game,
as well as the number of bits required to encode each input number. (2) We
give an efficient algorithm for approximately computing an optimal
extensive-form correlated equilibrium (EFCE) up to machine precision, i.e.,
the algorithm achieves approximation error Œµ in time polynomial in the size
of the game, as well as log(1/Œµ).

Our algorithm for SEFCE is the first polynomial-time algorithm for
equilibrium computation with commitment in such a general class of
stochastic games. Existing algorithms for SEFCE typically make stronger
assumptions such as no chance moves, and are designed for extensive-form
games in the less succinct tree form. Our algorithm for approximately
optimal EFCE is, to our knowledge, the first algorithm that achieves 3
desiderata simultaneously: approximate optimality, polylogarithmic
dependency on the approximation error and compatibility with stochastic
games in the more succinct graph form. Existing algorithms achieve at most
2 of these desiderata, often also relying on additional technical
assumptions.
