%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%E2%80%9CAdaptive%20Pricing%20in%20Combinatorial%20Auctions%E2%80%9D%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20Joint%20work%20with%20Sebastien%20Lahaie%2C%20Google%20Research%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20We%20introduce%20the%20first%20adaptively-priced%20iterative%20combinatorial%20auction%20design%2C%20which%20gradually%20extends%20price%20expressiveness%20as%20the%20rounds%20progress.%20This%20mechanism%20achieves%20both%20high%20efficiency%20and%20fast%20convergence%20across%20a%20wide%20range%20of%20valuation%20domains.%20We%20implement%20our%20auction%20design%20using%20polynomial%20prices%2C%20show%20how%20to%20detect%20when%20the%20current%20price%20structure%20is%20insufficient%20to%20clear%20the%20market%2C%20and%20show%20how%20to%20correctly%20expand%20the%20polynomial%20structure%20to%20guarantee%20progress.%20An%20experimental%20evaluation%20confirms%20that%20our%20auction%20is%20competitive%20with%20bundle-price%20auctions%20in%20domains%20where%20these%20excel%2C%20namely%20multi-minded%20valuations%2C%20but%20also%20performs%20well%20in%20domains%20favorable%20to%20linear%20prices%2C%20such%20as%20valuations%20with%20pairwise%20synergy.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20Talk%20II%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20The%20John%20Muir%20Trail%20(JMT)%20is%20a%20route%20through%20the%20California%20High%20Sierra%20started%20by%20appropriation%20of%20the%20California%20state%20legislature%20in%201915%20and%20completed%20by%20the%20National%20Park%20Service%20in%201938%20(that%20is%2C%20it%20took%2023%20years%20to%20complete).%20It%20snakes%20through%20213%20miles%20of%20the%20Sierras%20from%20Yosemite%20Valley%20to%20the%20peak%20of%20Mount%20Whitney%20at%2014%2C505%20feet.%20The%20trail%20gains%2047%2C000%20feet%20in%20elevation%20along%20its%20length%20and%20crosses%20numerous%20passes%20above%2012%2C000%20feet.%20Indeed%20once%20leaving%20the%20Yosemite%20Valley%20the%20trail%20rarely%20crosses%20below%208%2C000%20feet.%20For%20most%20of%20its%20length%2C%20the%20JMT%20is%20coincident%20with%20the%20longer%20Pacific%20Crest%20trail%20that%20runs%20from%20Mexico%20to%20Canada%20through%20the%20Pacific%20states.%20My%20brother%20and%20I%20hiked%20the%20trail%20over%20a%2020%20day%20period%20in%20August%202023%2C%20a%20period%20that%20included%20Hurricane%20Hillary%E2%80%99s%20arrival%20on%20the%20west%20coast.%20I%20will%20share%20some%20experience%20of%20the%20trail%2C%20some%20photos%2C%20and%20some%20thoughts%20about%20why%20one%20might%20want%20(or%20not%20want!)%20to%20embark%20on%20such%20an%20adventure.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20After%20receiving%20his%20Bachelor%E2%80%99s%20degree%20in%20Computer%20Science%20from%20Harvard%20University%20in%201999%2C%20Dr.%20Lubin%20joined%20BBN%20Technologies%2C%20the%20research%20and%20development%20firm%20where%20the%20first%20internet%20routers%20were%20developed%2C%20working%20on%20advanced%20multi-agent%20modeling%2C%20scheduling%2C%20and%20logistics%20systems.%20After%20six%20years%20in%20industry%2C%20he%20returned%20to%20Harvard%20University%20to%20pursue%20a%20Ph.D.%20at%20the%20intersection%20of%20computer%20science%2C%20game%20theory%2C%20and%20economics.%20He%20is%20now%20an%20Associate%20Professor%20in%20the%20Information%20Systems%20department%20of%20the%20Boston%20University%20Questrom%20School%20of%20Business.%20His%20research%20is%20in%20three%20primary%20areas%3A%20(1)%20mechanism%20design%2C%20especially%20of%20combinatorial%20auctions%20and%20exchanges%2C%20mechanisms%20that%20support%20efficient%20reallocation%20of%20goods%20when%20participants%20have%20complex%20preferences%20regarding%20bundles%20of%20items%2C%20(2)%20the%20use%20of%20spectral%20graph%20theory%20to%20advance%20the%20analysis%20of%20social%20networks%2C%20and%20(3)%20applications%20of%20network%20science%20and%20machine%20learning%20to%20understanding%20and%20improving%20the%20healthcare%20delivery%20system.%20Dr.%20Lubin%20is%20a%20recipient%20of%20the%20Siebel%20Fellowship%20and%20a%20Yahoo%20Key%20Technical%20Challenge%20award.%20Portions%20of%20his%20research%20are%20funded%20by%20NIHCM%20and%20the%20Veterans%20Administration.%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20Host%3A%20Professor%20Amy%20Greenwald&location=Watson%20Center%20for%20Information%20Technology%20(CIT)%2C%20Room%20316&trp=false&sprop=&sprop=name:>


Talk I
"Adaptive Pricing in Combinatorial Auctions"
Joint work with Sebastien Lahaie, Google Research

We introduce the first adaptively-priced iterative combinatorial auction
design, which gradually extends price expressiveness as the rounds
progress. This mechanism achieves both high efficiency and fast convergence
across a wide range of valuation domains. We implement our auction design
using polynomial prices, show how to detect when the current price
structure is insufficient to clear the market, and show how to correctly
expand the polynomial structure to guarantee progress. An experimental
evaluation confirms that our auction is competitive with bundle-price
auctions in domains where these excel, namely multi-minded valuations, but
also performs well in domains favorable to linear prices, such as
valuations with pairwise synergy.


Talk II
The John Muir Trail (JMT) is a route through the California High Sierra
started by appropriation of the California state legislature in 1915 and
completed by the National Park Service in 1938 (that is, it took 23 years
to complete).  It snakes through 213 miles of the Sierras from Yosemite
Valley to the peak of Mount Whitney at 14,505 feet.  The trail gains 47,000
feet in elevation along its length and crosses numerous passes above 12,000
feet.  Indeed once leaving the Yosemite Valley the trail rarely crosses
below 8,000 feet.  For most of its length, the JMT is coincident with the
longer Pacific Crest trail that runs from Mexico to Canada through the
Pacific states.  My brother and I hiked the trail over a 20 day period in
August 2023, a period that included Hurricane Hillary's arrival on the west
coast.  I will share some experience of the trail, some photos, and some
thoughts about why one might want (or not want!) to embark on such an
adventure.

After receiving his Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from Harvard
University in 1999, Dr. Lubin joined BBN Technologies, the research and
development firm where the first internet routers were developed, working
on advanced multi-agent modeling, scheduling, and logistics systems. After
six years in industry, he returned to Harvard University to pursue a Ph.D.
at the intersection of computer science, game theory, and economics. He is
now an Associate Professor in the Information Systems department of the
Boston University Questrom School of Business. His research is in three
primary areas: (1) mechanism design, especially of combinatorial auctions
and exchanges, mechanisms that support efficient reallocation of goods when
participants have complex preferences regarding bundles of items, (2) the
use of spectral graph theory to advance the analysis of social networks,
and (3) applications of network science and machine learning to
understanding and improving the healthcare delivery system. Dr. Lubin is a
recipient of the Siebel Fellowship and a Yahoo Key Technical Challenge
award. Portions of his research are funded by NIHCM and the Veterans
Administration.

Host: Professor Amy Greenwald

_______________________________________________
The Computer Science Department is located at 115 Waterman St., Providence,
RI. Our Calendar of Events at http://www.cs.brown.edu/events lists all of
our talks.

If you would like to be removed from (or added to) our seminar mailing
list, please send email containing your request to mailto:
talks-owner@lists.cs.brown.edu.

We'd very much appreciate your forwarding these announcements to colleagues
who may also have an interest. Thanks for your cooperation.

Subject: Fwd: [e-glamor] Tuesday Lab Talk - Revan MacQueen
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Wang, Kevin A. <kevin_a_wang@brown.edu>
Date: Sun, Nov 26, 2023 at 9:12‚ÄØPM
Subject: [e-glamor] Tuesday Lab Talk - Revan MacQueen
To: <e-glamor@lists.cs.brown.edu>


Hello everyone!
On Tuesday, Nov 28, at the regularly scheduled time (4 PM), Revan MacQueen
<https://www.revanmacqueen.com/> will present his recent work, done with
his advisor James R. Wright: "*Guarantees for Self-Play in Multiplayer
Games via Polymatrix Decomposability", accepted for NeurIPS 2023 (
https://arxiv.org/abs/2310.11518 <https://arxiv.org/abs/2310.11518> ).*

I think this paper is super cool, as it investigates the curious phenomenon
in which Pluribus (the first bot to beat humans in *multi-player* poker)
performed well despite using techniques (counterfactual regret
minimization) which were only guaranteed to work in *two-player* zero-sum
games. We have no reason to expect that those techniques (which produce
coarse correlated equilibria) should work well in a multiplayer (> 2
players) game, but for some reason they did. Is there something specific
about poker that enables these techniques to still work well? In the paper,
Revan and James dive into this question, with fascinating results!

Revan recently completed his Master's at the University of Alberta. He will
be talking about this work over Zoom. We will be in CIT 368 as usual.

See you there!
-Kevin Wang

Subject: Fwd: [APMA-1740-S01] Fwd: Alice's Talk
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Geman, Stuart <stuart_geman@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Jan 30, 2024 at 2:30‚ÄØPM
Subject: [APMA-1740-S01] Fwd: Alice's Talk
To: course 1740 spring 2024 <
course.apma.1740.2024-spring.s01@lists.brown.edu>, course 2610 spring 2024 <
course.apma.2610.2024-spring.s01@lists.brown.edu>



Of possible interest: please see forwarded message and details from
Professor Hui Wang.


---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Wang, Hui <hui_wang@brown.edu>
Date: Mon, Jan 29, 2024 at 6:03‚ÄØPM
Subject: Alice's Talk
To: apma_faculty <APMA_Faculty@brown.edu>
Cc: Hui Wang <hui_wang@brown.edu>


Dear Everyone,

I hope you are doing well.

We have a lecturer search interview talk coming up next Monday (Feb 5), and
would like to invite undergraduates to attend to simulate the classroom
environment. Could you please forward the following message to your class,
if it is not too much trouble?

Many thanks for your help.

Best wishes
Hui

=====================================

Dear students,

Applied Math is interviewing a candidate for the Lecturer position. The
candidate will give an example lecture on a topic that would be appropriate
for APMA 1650 or APMA 350/360. We need undergraduate students to attend
these lectures to simulate the classroom environment and to give us
feedback afterwards. The talk will consist of a 30 minute lecture followed
by a brief discussion.

You are very welcome to attend the sample lecture and provide feedback to
those of us who are evaluating the candidates.

Monday, Feb 05, 3:00-4:00pm (30 minutes talk + brief discussion)
Room 108, 170 Hope Street

Please let me (Hui_Wang@brown.edu) know if you are able to attend the talk.

Feel free to forward this invitation to any of your friends that might be
interested, especially if they have taken APMA 1650 and APMA 350/360 or the
equivalent.

Thanks! And I hope you have a great semester.

Best wishes
Hui

On Tue, Jan 30, 2024 at 6:22‚ÄØPM Carlotta Borruto <
carlotta@italiainnovation.com> wrote:

> Dear Larry and Nick,
>
> This is Carlotta Borruto, Executive Director of Italia Innovation
> <https://italiainnovation.com/about/>.
> I'm writing to you to share that we‚Äôve just opened the applications for the* 2024
> Italia Innovation Program* (see below).
>
> If you think that's an interesting opportunity for the members of the *Brown
> Investment Group*, it'd be great if you could help us spread the word.
>
> Thank you and of course let me know if you have any questions.
>
> Best,
> Carlotta
>
> ------------------
>
> Applications for the *2024 Italia Innovation Program*
> <https://summer.italiainnovation.com/> are now open!
>
> *1st - 19th July 2024, Italy*
>
> Make your summer unforgettable with a *fully-immersive learning
> experience*: a three-week countrywide exploration of the future of
> Italian economy and society with a world-class faculty, Italian business
> and political leaders and a multidisciplinary cohort of global scholars.
>
> Participants will be challenged by Italian leading brands and institutions
> to rethink their operational models and value propositions, all while
> receiving the mentorship of a* unique team of experts and professors* like
> John Paul Rollert (UChicago Booth), Stewart Thornhill (UMichigan Ross),
> William Peduto (former Mayor of Pittsburgh), Peter Boatwright (Carnegie
> Mellon University), as well as journalists like Amy Goldstein (2002
> Pulitzer Award, The Washington Post) and Elizabeth Segran (Fast Company).
>
> Company visits, industry insights, hands-on seminars, inspirational talks
> foster the industry understanding and inspire the project works.* Case
> studies and visits* are developed directly with leaders and owners of *leading
> brands in the Made in Italy* business sectors (Fashion, Design, Food and
> Wine, Arts and High-end Manufacturing). Past challengers include Zegna,
> Ferragamo, Gucci, Barilla, Lavazza and illy Coffee.
>
> Accommodation and local transportation are designed to offer a *true
> Italian experience*, residing inside a 18th century Palladian Villa and
> moving around the country with a comfortable double-decker premium coach.
>
> We really believe in innovating the Italian economy and society. Do you?
>
> *Apply now* <https://summer.italiainnovation.com/apply/> and please note
> that *full and partial tuition scholarships* are available for early
> applicants!
>
> --------------------------
> Carlotta Borruto | Co-Founder and Executive Director
> *Italia Innovation* || italiainnovation.com
>
> This message is being sent from Italia Innovation Srl and may contain
> information which is confidential or privileged. Italia Innovation is a
> trademark registered in the U.S. and other countries.

Subject: Fwd: [Ugrad] CS Department hiring Health and Wellness Advocate
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Clarke, Lauren <lauren_clarke@brown.edu>
Date: Thu, Jan 18, 2024 at 8:18‚ÄØAM
Subject: [Ugrad] CS Department hiring Health and Wellness Advocate
To: <concentrator@lists.cs.brown.edu>, ugrad <ugrad@lists.cs.brown.edu>


Hi All-

The CS Department has an immediate opening for a Health and Wellness
Advocate; we encourage you to read the description below and apply here
<https://forms.gle/rkaYHbezHFjrRvHC7>.

Job Description:

Duties of the position include, but aren‚Äôt limited to:

1) Working with individual students on a case-by-case basis in order to
address issues related to mental & physical health, accessibility,
disability rights, and accommodations. This includes:


   - Holding Health & Wellness office hours, to connect students with
   campus and peer resources that are relevant to the issues or pressures they
   may be facing
   - Serving as a peer resource and facilitating conversations between
   students, faculty and staff around mental and physical health, student
   wellness, and disability rights and accessibility (e.g. SAS and Deans
   accommodations, TA leave)
   -  Responding to student-reported instances of harm and working in
   conjunction with students to craft resolutions that preserve the student‚Äôs
   agency

2) Working collaboratively with the CS Diversity Committee to evaluate and
address institutional challenges surrounding mental and physical health,
wellness, accessibility, disability rights and accommodations:


   - Serving as a member of the Brown CS Diversity Committee, helping
   refine, implement, evaluate, and update the Brown CS Diversity Action Plan
   (DDIAP), as necessary to achieve the department‚Äôs goals for diversity and
   inclusion
   - Attending monthly committee meetings with faculty, staff and graduate
   students, and attending weekly student advocate cohort meetings
   - Creating, implementing and leading semesterly UTA Accessibility
   Training, developing accessibility and self-care TA workshops, and
   promoting health, wellness and accessibility in all aspects of the Brown CS
   UTA program
   - Advocating and providing resources for best practices for course
   accessibility, universal design and website accessibility across Brown CS
   - Raising awareness of issues and resources surrounding health,
   wellness, accessibility, disability rights, and inclusion by disseminating
   information, and organizing events and workshops
   - Creating a project proposal to address specific goal related to a
   personal area of interest


Required Experience:

   1. Completed and/or enrolled in at least 1 CS course
   2. Considering/declared CS/joint-CS or related concentration, or other
   commitment to continued involvement in the CS department

Preferred Experience (not required):

   1. Facilitation and Mentorship
   2. Leadership and Teamwork
   3. Social Justice Advocacy

Time Commitment:  ~10 hours per week
Pay: $20.50/hour

-- 
Lauren Clarke
Department Manager
Department of Computer Science
401-863-7603


-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
To change your subscription settings, visit lists.cs.brown.edu and click the
"Brown Login" button to authenticate via Shibboleth.
To stop receiving mail to ugrad@lists.cs.brown.edu, find "ugrad" in your
list of subscriptions at the left, click "Subscriber Options", and then
select "no mail".
This list is automatically generated based on course enrollment and TA /
concentrator rosters.

Subject: Fwd: Goody Grams üíå
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Class Coordinating Board <classboard@brown.edu>
Date: Tue, Jan 30, 2024 at 9:19‚ÄØPM
Subject: Goody Grams üíå
To: <community.classboard.junior@lists.brown.edu>


Hello, Class of 2025!

Welcome back! We hope you had a wonderful winter break and hope that
shopping period has been smooth sailing! As we get closer to Valentine‚Äôs
Day, we‚Äôre excited to bring back‚Ä¶

üíóValentine‚Äôs Day Goody Gramsüíó



Want to send a gift to a friend, crush, or significant other in the Class
of 2025? We have you covered with our Valentine‚Äôs Day Goody Grams! Each
Goody Gram holds temporary tattoos, allergen-safe sweets, and the option to
add a note or make it anonymous!

*The first 150 individuals who pick up their Goody Grams will also receive
1 free rose!*


üíûHow it worksüíû

You may choose to have the receiver pick up their Goody Gram from CCB 2025
or select the option for you (the sender) to pick it up and personally
deliver it to your CCBae on Wednesday, February 14th in the Blue Room from
12 - 5 pm.

But wait, is your CCBestie or CCBoo abroad or away from campus? No worries,
we have you covered with digital Goody Grams!

Fill out this form <https://forms.gle/2b8tJhinjM8gwHL18> to order FREE
Valentine‚Äôs Day Goody Grams by Wednesday, February 7th at 11:59 PM EST.

Lots of love,

üíòYour 2025 Class Coordinating Boardüíò

Jazz Carlson, President

Ivy Zhuang, Vice-President

Christine Wu, Secretary

Swaraj Agarwal, Treasurer

Minnie Zhang, Public Relations Officer

Kelly Wei, Community Outreach Officer

IG: @brownccb25 <https://instagram.com/brownccb25?r=nametag>

Website: www.brownccb.org

in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity, regardless
of any identities they may hold. CCB prohibits harassment and retaliation

Subject: Fwd: Skate Your Heart Out with CCB ‚õ∏
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Class Coordinating Board <classboard@brown.edu>
Date: Wed, Jan 31, 2024 at 3:04‚ÄØPM
Subject: Skate Your Heart Out with CCB ‚õ∏
To: <community.classboard.junior@lists.brown.edu>



Hello, Class of 2025!

We hope you are having a fantastic beginning to your semester! While you
are filling out your Valentine‚Äôs Day Goody Grams (*ordering form linked *
*here* <https://forms.gle/kxjLxTk44ggLZWPX8>*, in case you missed it!*), we
are here to announce another really exciting event to be on the lookout
for: *Ice Skating at BankNewport City Center!*

‚õ∏Ice Skating: BankNewport City Center ‚õ∏


Make sure to come out and enjoy Ice Skating on Saturday, February 10th from
12 pm - 4 pm! There will be light refreshments as well! Make sure you wear
some warm clothes, including gloves and a hat! We are so excited to see you
there!

‚ùÑÔ∏èThere is NO PRE-REGISTRATION for this event!!‚ùÑÔ∏è

That‚Äôs right, no sign-ups needed! Instead, tickets will be distributed to
the first 100 juniors or seniors that arrive at BankNewport City Center
with their Brown ID during the 12 pm - 2 pm skating block, and then 100
additional tickets will be distributed for the 2 pm - 4 pm block, so get
there ASAP! Even if you are not the first 100 to arrive, you can still get
a discounted ticket to skate with our friends with a Brown ID.

Hope to see you there!

Lots of love,

ü§éYour 2025 Class Coordinating Boardü§é

Subject: Fwd: 2/13 Finance Spotlight - Attendance
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Fontaine, Tiffany <tiffany_fontaine@brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Jan 26, 2024 at 12:33‚ÄØPM
Subject: 2/13 Finance Spotlight - Attendance
To:


Hi there!

I am emailing you now because you've successfully secured a spot for
the *Finance
Spotlight event on Tuesday, 2/13, from 5:30 to 8 pm*. The event spans the
entire duration, and your arrival at 5:30 pm is expected. However, if you
need to leave early, anytime after 7:15 pm is acceptable.

Given the substantial waitlist for this event, if you are certain that you
won't be able to attend, please take a moment to unregister by clicking here
<https://app.joinhandshake.com/stu/events/1447420>. We'll be keeping track
of attendance, and any no-shows will be noted. Alternatively, feel free to
inform me directly if you cannot attend.

In the upcoming weeks, I'll be sending a few more emails to confirm your
attendance. Our goal is to ensure the most accurate headcount possible.

I appreciate your time in advance. Thank you!

Best,
Tiffany

-- 
Tiffany Fontaine (She/Her)
Assistant Director of Employer Partnerships

<https://career-center.brown.edu/>

Direct line: 401.863.3474
167 Angell St. Providence, RI 02912
Box 1907 | Front Desk: (401) 863-3326

Subject: Fwd: First Info Session Today!
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Brown Consulting Club <brownconsultingclub@brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Jan 26, 2024 at 1:59‚ÄØPM
Subject: First Info Session Today!
To: <adam_lalani@brown.edu>


Hi everyone!

This is a reminder that our first info session is scheduled for tonight,
from 6pm - 7:30pm in Friedman 102. It features a panel discussion with some
of our amazing club members. Additionally, we are holding an
additional session tomorrow, from 4pm - 5:30pm at the same location, which
includes an application workshop. Both sessions are designed to guide you
through our recruitment process and showcase the benefits of joining BCC.
We're excited to see you there!

After tomorrow's info session, we are holding open hours from 6pm - 9pm at
The Underground where you can connect with and ask questions to members of
our organization. We are dedicating the first hour (6pm to 7pm) for
individuals who identify with historically underrepresented groups in the
consulting field.

If you cannot make either info session please email dane_elliott@brown.edu by
the end of the day tomorrow. Attendance of one our info sessions is a
*required* part of our application process.

For further updates be sure to follow our instagram
<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=edcf734cf9&e=3e25b0d712>
or go to our website
<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=a54e779256&e=3e25b0d712>.
If
you have not started your application, you can find it here
<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=1837c1302c&e=3e25b0d712>.
Looking forward to meeting everyone soon!

[image: Instagram]
<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=2f554054ea&e=3e25b0d712>

<https://brown.us19.list-manage.com/track/click?u=f4bd8d81d0d94cf7eeaf98459&id=060c7f1528&e=3e25b0d712>!*

Subject: Fwd: Yu-Gi-BrunOh! Official Confirmation!!!!!
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Kaminski, Filip <filip_kaminski@brown.edu>
Date: Mon, Jan 29, 2024 at 11:34‚ÄØAM
Subject: Yu-Gi-BrunOh! Official Confirmation!!!!!
To: Filip Kaminski <filip_kaminski@brown.edu>, Christina Peng <
christina_peng@brown.edu>, Jennie Wang <jennie_wang@brown.edu>, Bokai Bi <
bokai_bi@brown.edu>, Matthias Yee <matthias_yee@brown.edu>, Vincent Zhou <
vincent_zhou@brown.edu>, Iris Yang <iris_yang@brown.edu>, George Chudley <
george_chudley@brown.edu>, Evan Braho <evan_braho@brown.edu>, Max Guo <
max_guo@brown.edu>, Alexander Wood <alexander_wood@brown.edu>, David
Naranjo <david_naranjo@brown.edu>, Thomas Cronin <thomas_cronin@brown.edu>,
Destin Encardes <destin_encardes@brown.edu>, <hao_wen@brown.edu>, Camille
Aquino <camille_aquino@brown.edu>, Chai Harsha <chaitanya_harsha@brown.edu>,
Alex Pearson <alex_pearson@brown.edu>, Jarrett Fernandes <
jarrett_fernandes@brown.edu>, Malcolm Certain <malcolm_certain@brown.edu>,
Patrick Rui De Jing <patrick_rui_de_jing@brown.edu>, <anna_e_brown@brown.edu>,
<lchan02@risd.edu>, Michael Tu <michael_s_tu@brown.edu>, Andrew Furst <
andrew_furst@brown.edu>, Ben Cherek <ben_cherek@brown.edu>, Anthony Boss <
anthony_boss@brown.edu>, Emily Wang <emily_m_wang@brown.edu>, Carter
Paterson <Carter_paterson@brown.edu>, Daniel Marella <
Daniel_marella@brown.edu>, Neal Klemba <neal_klemba@brown.edu>, Victor
Chang <victor_a_chang@brown.edu>, David Chanin <david_b_chanin@brown.edu>,
Emmanuel Ojeda <Emmanuel_Ojeda@brown.edu>, Desmond Yeo <
hao_khai_yeo@brown.edu>, Eiffel Sunga <eiffel_sunga@brown.edu>, Eduardo
Adriano <eduardo_adriano@brown.edu>, Rakin Haq <rakin_haq@brown.edu>,
Alexander Gonzalez <alexander_gonzalez@brown.edu>, Kevin A. Wang <
kevin_a_wang@brown.edu>, Nicholas Olson <nicholas_m_olson@brown.edu>, Eric
Bae <Eric_bae@brown.edu>, Matthew McQuistion <Matthew_mcquistion@brown.edu>,
Julien Strick <julien_strick@brown.edu>, Emilio Peveri <
emilio_peveri@brown.edu>, Alan Lucero <alan_lucero@brown.edu>, Doren
Hsiao-Wecksler <Doren_Hsiao-wecksler@brown.edu>, Edward Wibowo <
edward_wibowo@brown.edu>, Edison Chang <edison_chang@brown.edu>, Adam
Lalani <adam_lalani@brown.edu>, Donovan Homsey <donovan_homsey@brown.edu>,
Razan Haweizy <razan_haweizy@brown.edu>, Axel Brito <axel_brito@brown.edu>,
<qhuang02@risd.edu>, Kevin A. Wang <Kawang@brown.edu>


Calling all duelists,

UCS has **finally** graced us with official club confirmation! I'm really
excited to start club activities and work with everyone!

Here is the discord link <https://discord.gg/Xcs4u2wqKY>, its where most
correspondence will happen for club announcements etc. (maybe important
stuff will be emailed we will figure that out as we go along)

*General Plans*: Read if you want to know plans for club, otherwise just
click the discord link

So a lot of people had the question of what we will do for providing
physical cards, and the general gist is this. The club has around $300 to
work with, as such this semester probably will not allow us to provide a
lot of cards, with that said, I want to get at least one "club deck" for
everyone to use. I would also want to try and provide cards via tournaments
but more on that later.
*(online play might be a solution to this, but eventually I want to move to
fully physical play. *with some exceptions)*

Second, Learn-To-Play sessions will be a *PRIORITY* for the club as a lot
of people signed up to either get back into the game or to learn. For the
experienced players, I'm sure you know that this game is definitely "very
easy".......... so if anyone would like to help out in teaching new
players, feel free to reach out!

Third, apart from just casual play I want the club to hold tournaments,
some of which could be for prizes, more information will be given out as
more planning is done, so stay tuned!!!

Lastly, I really want to do trips to the local tournaments in the
Providence area, so as above, stay tuned for more info on that!

Join the discord....here's the link again just in case
https://discord.gg/Xcs4u2wqKY

Hope to see you soon!
Filip Kaminski  (Your president)

Subject: Fwd: BIG Recruiting Field Trip to NYC
Data:
---------- Forwarded message ---------
From: Tre Tucci <francis_tucci1@brown.edu>
Date: Fri, Feb 2, 2024 at 7:03‚ÄØPM
Subject: Re: BIG Recruiting Field Trip to NYC
To: Brown Investment Group <big@brown.edu>


Lmk if I can help w this in any way

On Feb 2, 2024, at 4:32‚ÄØPM, Brown Investment Group <big@brown.edu> wrote:

Ôªø
Hi everyone,

We are proud to announce our first annual Recruiting Field Trip to New York
City, occurring on *February 12th*. We will be visiting LionTree (a
boutique investment bank specializing in TMT), Point72, and potentially 1
or 2 other high-target firms with a strong desire to recruit from Brown.
This is an incredible opportunity for recruiting Sophomores to network in
person and visit the places you may be working next summer.

This trip will be open exclusively to Sophomores in BIG. We are constrained
to accept ~15 students. If you are interested, please submit an application
(at the link below) by *TUESDAY* morning at *10:00 AM* (*2/6/24*).
Applications submitted afterwards will not be considered.


Thank you and we are looking forward to supporting BIG members that are
recruiting in every way possible.


https://forms.gle/oxeFc9qSYgg9TfGk8


Best,

BIG E-Board



Brown Investment Group

big@brown.edu

browninvestmentgroup.co
